sentences.english: A sign saying ‘No Fishing’ had been nailed to the tree.
sentences.chinese: 树上钉着一块写有“禁止钓鱼”的牌子。

detailed_translations.english: a thin pointed piece of metal with a flat top, which you hit into a surface with a hammer, for example to join things together or to hang something on
to fasten something to something else with nails

name: noise
trans: Noise is a loud or unpleasant sound.

sentences.english: What’s that noise?
sentences.chinese: 那是什么声音？

sentences.english: Try not to make a noise when you go upstairs.
sentences.chinese: 上楼时尽量不要弄出声。

sentences.english: There was a lot of noise outside.
sentences.chinese: 外面很吵闹。

sentences.english: Noise levels have been reduced by 20%.
sentences.chinese: 噪音水平下降了20%。

detailed_translations.english: a sound, especially one that is loud, unpleasant, or frightening

name: occasion
trans: An occasion is a particular time when something happens or an event is celebrated.

sentences.english: I’m saving this bottle of champagne for a special occasion.
sentences.chinese: 我要把这瓶香槟酒留到特别的日子喝。

sentences.english: She had met Zahid on two separate occasions.
sentences.chinese: 她遇到过扎希德两次。

sentences.english: This was the occasion for expressions of friendship by the two presidents.
sentences.chinese: 这是两位总统进行友好交流的时机。

detailed_translations.english: an important social event or ceremony

name: package
trans: A package is a box or container used for transporting or storing items.

sentences.english: There’s a package here for a Miami Lakes address.
sentences.chinese: 这里有一个寄往迈阿密湖的包裹。

detailed_translations.english: something wrapped in paper, packed in a box, and then sent by mail or delivered
to put food or other goods into a bag, box etc ready to be sold or sent

name: patient
trans: A patient is a person receiving medical treatment or care.

sentences.english: You’ll just have to be patient and wait till I’m off the phone.
sentences.chinese: 你只能耐心点，等我打完电话。

sentences.english: She was tough but wonderful with her patients.
sentences.chinese: 她很严厉，但对病人很好。

detailed_translations.english: able to wait calmly for a long time or to accept difficulties, people’s annoying behaviour etc without becoming angry
someone who is receiving medical treatment from a doctor or in a hospital

name: pause
trans: To pause is to stop briefly before continuing.

sentences.english: There was a pause while Alice changed the tape.
sentences.chinese: 艾丽斯换磁带的时候出现了短暂的停顿。

sentences.english: After a long pause , she went on.
sentences.chinese: 停了好一会儿，她才继续下去。

detailed_translations.english: a short time during which someone stops speaking or doing something before starting again
to stop speaking or doing something for a short time before starting again

name: phrase
trans: A phrase is a group of words used together in a sentence to convey a specific meaning.

sentences.english: It is impossible to hypnotise someone simply by saying a particular word or phrase.
sentences.chinese: 不可能仅通过说某个词或短语就能把人催眠。

sentences.english: Who first used the phrase ‘survival of the fittest’?
sentences.chinese: “适者生存”这一说法最早是谁说的？

sentences.english: Shakespeare’s plays are full of well-known phrases .
sentences.chinese: 莎士比亚的戏剧中写满了众所周知的名言警句。

detailed_translations.english: a group of words without a finite verb, especially when they are used to form part of a sentence, such as ‘walking along the road’ and ‘a bar of soap’

name: proof
trans: Proof is evidence or confirmation that something is true or accurate.

sentences.english: Their defences are proof against most weapons.
sentences.chinese: 他们的防卫工事可以抵挡大多数武器的攻击。

detailed_translations.english: facts, information, documents etc that prove something is true

name: race
trans: A race is a competition between people, animals, or vehicles to determine who is the fastest.

sentences.english: The race is on to develop more environmentally friendly forms of energy.
sentences.chinese: 人们正在竞相开发更环保的能源形式。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which one group of people tries to obtain or achieve something before another group does

name: relief
trans: Relief is a feeling of comfort or happiness that comes from being free of pain, anxiety, or stress.

sentences.english: Marijuana can provide pain relief for some cancer patients.
sentences.chinese: 大麻可以为一些癌症患者减轻疼痛。

sentences.english: money raised for the relief effort
sentences.chinese: 为赈灾筹集的钱款

detailed_translations.english: when something reduces someone’s pain or unhappy feelings

name: sand
trans: Sand is a substance made of small grains of rock or minerals, often found on beaches or in deserts.

sentences.english: a mixture of sand and cement
sentences.chinese: 沙和水泥的混合物

sentences.english: I have sand in my shoe.
sentences.chinese: 我的鞋里有沙子。

detailed_translations.english: a substance consisting of very small pieces of rocks and minerals, that forms beaches and deserts

detailed_translations.chinese: 撒沙于；以沙掩盖；用砂纸等擦平或磨光某物；使撒沙似地布满；给…掺沙子
detailed_translations.english: to make a surface smooth by rubbing it with  sandpaper  or using a special piece of equipment

name: sentence
trans: A sentence is a group of words that expresses a complete thought or idea.

sentences.english: She received an eight-year prison sentence.
sentences.chinese: 她被判八年徒刑。

sentences.english: He has just begun a life sentence for murder.
sentences.chinese: 他犯了谋杀罪，刚开始服无期徒刑。

sentences.english: Sanchez was sentenced to three years in prison.
sentences.chinese: 桑切斯被判了三年监禁。

detailed_translations.english: a punishment that a judge gives to someone who is guilty of a crime
if a judge sentences someone who is guilty of a crime, they give them a punishment

name: shoulder
trans: A shoulder is the part of the body that connects the arm to the torso.

sentences.english: The residents are being asked to shoulder the costs of the repairs.
sentences.chinese: 居民们被要求承担这笔修理费用。

sentences.english: They shouldered the boat and took it down to the river.
sentences.chinese: 他们把船扛在肩上抬到河里。

detailed_translations.english: to accept a difficult or unpleasant responsibility, duty etc

name: smoke
trans: Smoke is a visible suspension of particles in the air, typically created by burning something.

sentences.english: I don’t smoke and I don’t drink much.
sentences.chinese: 我不吸烟，酒也喝得不多。

sentences.english: Do you mind if I smoke?
sentences.chinese: 我抽烟你介意吗？

sentences.english: He sat on the grass smoking a cigarette.
sentences.chinese: 他坐在草地上吸烟。

sentences.english: He admitted that he had smoked marijuana when he was a student.
sentences.chinese: 他承认在读书时吸过大麻。

sentences.english: a smoking chimney
sentences.chinese: 冒烟的烟囱

sentences.english: Smoke from burning fields drifted across nearby roads.
sentences.chinese: 地里燃烧产生的烟雾飘到了附近的公路上。

detailed_translations.english: to suck or breathe in smoke from a cigarette, pipe etc or to do this regularly as a habit
white, grey or black gas that is produced by something burning

name: stomach
trans: The stomach is an organ in the body that breaks down food for digestion.

sentences.english: I was so hungry my stomach hurt.
sentences.chinese: 我饿得胃都痛了。

sentences.english: His stomach was full of food.
sentences.chinese: 他的胃里塞满了食物。

detailed_translations.english: the organ inside your body where food begins to be  digested
to be able to accept something, especially something unpleasant

name: string
trans: A string is a thin piece of cord or material used for tying or holding things together.

sentences.english: Her key hung on a string around her neck.
sentences.chinese: 她的钥匙穿了根绳子挂在脖子上。

sentences.english: a ball of string
sentences.chinese: 一团细绳

sentences.english: I need a piece of string to tie this package.
sentences.chinese: 我需要一根绳子来捆这个包裹。

sentences.english: a string of pearls
sentences.chinese: 一串珍珠

detailed_translations.english: a strong thread made of several threads twisted together, used for tying or fastening things

name: tourist
trans: A tourist is a person who travels to a place for pleasure or culture.

sentences.english: Cambridge is always full of tourists in the summer.
sentences.chinese: 剑桥在夏季总是挤满了游客。

sentences.english: The Statue of Liberty is a major tourist attraction .
sentences.chinese: 自由女神像是主要的旅游景点。

sentences.english: What effect will this have on the local tourist industry ?
sentences.chinese: 这对当地的旅游业会有什么影响？

detailed_translations.english: someone who is visiting a place for pleasure on holiday

name: towel
trans: A towel is a piece of absorbent fabric used for drying things, such as the body or dishes.

sentences.english: Have you got a clean towel I could use?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有干净毛巾给我用？

detailed_translations.english: a piece of cloth that you use for drying your skin or for drying things such as dishes
to dry yourself using a towel

name: vacation
trans: A vacation is a period of time when a person takes a break from work or daily routine to relax or travel.

sentences.english: What will you do this vacation?
sentences.chinese: 你这个假期将干什么？

sentences.english: Do you have any vacation plans?
sentences.chinese: 您假期有什么安排吗？

sentences.english: Do you have any idea for this vacation?
sentences.chinese: 这个假期你有什么想法吗？

detailed_translations.english: to go somewhere for a holiday
a holiday, or time spent not working

name: west
trans: The west is a cardinal direction that is opposite of east, often used to refer to a region or location.

sentences.english: The route then heads west over Gerrick Moor.
sentences.chinese: 之后这条路折向西，穿过格里克漠泽。

sentences.english: the west door of the church
sentences.chinese: 教堂的西门

sentences.english: A damp wind blew from the west.
sentences.chinese: 从西面吹来一股潮湿的风。

sentences.english: a west-facing window
sentences.chinese: 朝西的窗户

detailed_translations.english: towards the west
in the west or facing the west
the direction towards which the sun goes down, and which is on the left if you are facing north

name: wheel
trans: A wheel is a circular object that rotates around an axis and is used to facilitate movement or transportation.

sentences.english: Shall I take the wheel (= drive instead of someone else )?
sentences.chinese: 我来开车好吗？

detailed_translations.english: one of the round things under a car, bus, bicycle etc that turns when it moves

detailed_translations.chinese: 转动；使变换方向；给…装轮子
detailed_translations.english: to push something that has wheels somewhere

name: wine
trans: Wine is an alcoholic beverage made from fermented grapes or other fruits.

sentences.english: a glass of wine
sentences.chinese: 一杯葡萄酒

detailed_translations.english: an alcoholic drink made from grapes, or a type of this drink
to entertain someone well with a meal, wine etc

name: arm
trans: An arm is a limb on the body that extends from the shoulder to the hand.

sentences.english: Dave has a broken arm .
sentences.chinese: 戴夫手臂断了。

sentences.english: Tim’s mother put her arms around him.
sentences.chinese: 蒂姆的母亲伸出双臂搂着他。

sentences.english: Pat was carrying a box under his arm .
sentences.chinese: 帕特腋下挟着一个盒子。

sentences.english: He had a pile of books in his arms .
sentences.chinese: 他抱着一摞书。

sentences.english: They walked along the beach arm in arm (=  with their arms bent around each other’s  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们臂挽臂走在沙滩上。

sentences.english: The old lady rushed to greet him, arms outstretched .
sentences.chinese: 老太太张开双臂，快步上前迎接他。

detailed_translations.chinese: 手臂；武器；袖子；装备；部门
detailed_translations.english: one of the two long parts of your body between your shoulders and your hands
to provide weapons for yourself, an army, a country etc in order to prepare for a fight or a war

name: aside
trans: Aside is a word that means to move something to the side or out of the way, or to mention something in addition to the main point.

sentences.english: He pushed his half-eaten salad aside and left.
sentences.chinese: 他推开吃了一半的色拉走了。

sentences.english: He stepped aside to let Katherine go in first.
sentences.chinese: 他站到一边让凯瑟琳先进去。

sentences.english: Mark drew me aside and explained the problem.
sentences.chinese: 马克把我拉到一边给我解释这个问题。

sentences.english: She swept her thick hair aside.
sentences.chinese: 她把浓密的头发梳到一边。

detailed_translations.english: moved to one side or away from you

name: associate
trans: To associate is to connect or link things or people together in some way.

sentences.english: Through science we've got the idea of associating progress with the future.
sentences.chinese: 通过科学我们已有了将进步与未来联系起来的观念。

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…联系在一起；使联合，结合；交往	[ə'səuʃiət]
detailed_translations.english: to make a connection in your mind between one thing or person and another
someone who is a member etc of something, but who is at a lower level and has fewer rights
someone who you work or do business with

name: bet
trans: A bet is a wager or agreement in which a person risks something of value on the outcome of an event or contest.

sentences.english: How much do you want to bet?
sentences.chinese: 你想赌多少钱？

sentences.english: a £50 bet
sentences.chinese: 50英镑的赌注

detailed_translations.english: to risk money on the result of a race, game, competition, or other future event
an agreement to risk money on the result of a race, game etc or on something happening, or the money that you risk

name: blow
trans: To blow is to move air forcefully through your mouth or other means, often causing movement or sound.

sentences.english: A cold breeze was blowing hard.
sentences.chinese: 寒风劲吹。

sentences.english: It was blowing from an easterly direction.
sentences.chinese: 这是从东面吹过来的。

sentences.english: Outside, the weather was blowing a gale.
sentences.chinese: 外面狂风大作。

sentences.english: Her hair was blowing in the breeze.
sentences.chinese: 她的头发在微风中飘扬。

sentences.english: The whistle blew for half time.
sentences.chinese: 哨声响起，上半场结束。

detailed_translations.english: if the wind or a current of air blows, it moves

name: border
trans: A border is the line or area separating two countries, regions, or places.

sentences.english: countries that border the Mediterranean
sentences.chinese: 地中海沿岸的国家

sentences.english: ...the European and Arab countries bordering the Mediterranean.
sentences.chinese: …地中海沿岸的欧洲国家和阿拉伯国家。

detailed_translations.english: if one country, state, or area borders another, it is next to it and shares a border with it
a band along or around the edge of something such as a picture or piece of material
A country that borders another country, a sea, or a river is next to it

name: branch
trans: A branch is a part of a tree that grows out from the trunk or another branch, or a division of a company or organization.

sentences.english: After the storm, the ground was littered with twigs and branches.
sentences.chinese: 暴风雨过后，满地都是大大小小的树枝。

sentences.english: The topmost branches were full of birds.
sentences.chinese: 树梢上停满了鸟儿。

sentences.english: She now works in our Denver branch.
sentences.chinese: 现在她在我们的丹佛分部工作。

sentences.english: a branch of mathematics/physics/biology etc
sentences.chinese: 数学/物理/生物学等的分支

detailed_translations.english: a part of a tree that grows out from the trunk and that has leaves, fruit, or smaller branches growing from it

name: breast
trans: A breast is the front part of a person's chest, usually referring to a female's mammary gland used for breastfeeding.

sentences.english: These bras are specially designed for women with large breasts.
sentences.chinese: 这些胸罩专为乳房丰满的女性设计。

sentences.english: breast milk
sentences.chinese: 母乳

sentences.english: breast cancer
sentences.chinese: 乳腺癌

sentences.english: Dick cradled her photograph against his breast.
sentences.chinese: 迪克把她的照片轻轻拥在胸前。

detailed_translations.english: one of the two round raised parts on a woman’s chest that produce milk when she has a baby

name: brother
trans: A brother is a male sibling, sharing at least one parent.

sentences.english: I have two brothers, William and Mark.
sentences.chinese: 我有两个兄弟，威廉和马克。

sentences.english: My big brother (=  older brother  ) has always looked after me.
sentences.chinese: 我哥哥一直照顾我。

sentences.english: my twin brother
sentences.chinese: 我的双胞胎兄弟

sentences.english: We must work together, brothers!
sentences.chinese: 我们必须携手工作，伙计们！

detailed_translations.english: a male who has the same parents as you

name: buddy
trans: A buddy is a friend or companion.

sentences.english: We’re good buddies.
sentences.chinese: 我们是好朋友。

detailed_translations.chinese: 伙伴，好朋友；密友；小男孩
detailed_translations.english: a friend

name: bunch
trans: A bunch is a group of objects or people that are together in a cluster or tightly packed.

sentences.english: She bunched the cloth up and threw it away.
sentences.chinese: 她把布揉成一团扔了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 集中， 挤在一起； 形成一束
detailed_translations.english: to pull material together tightly in folds
a group of things that are fastened, held, or growing together
to hold or tie things together in a bunch

name: chip
trans: A chip is a small piece or fragment that has been broken or cut off from a larger object or material, often referring to a small piece of semiconductor material used in electronic devices.

sentences.english: the age of the silicon chip
sentences.chinese: 芯片时代

sentences.english: chip technology
sentences.chinese: 芯片技术

detailed_translations.chinese: 屑片， 碎片； 炸土豆条； 集成电路片， 集成块； 缺口， 瑕疵
detailed_translations.english: a small piece of  silicon  that has a set of complicated electrical connections on it and is used to store and  process  information in computers

name: coach
trans: A coach is a person who trains or instructs someone in a particular sport or activity, or a vehicle for carrying passengers, typically with multiple seats.

sentences.english: a tennis coach
sentences.chinese: 网球教练

sentences.english: the Norwegian national coach
sentences.chinese: 挪威国家队教练

detailed_translations.english: someone who trains a person or team in a sport

name: cross
trans: To cross is to move from one side of something to the other, often referring to walking or traveling.

sentences.english: The by-pass crosses Wilton Lane shortly after a roundabout.
sentences.chinese: 这条旁道绕过环岛后不久就和威尔顿巷相交。

detailed_translations.chinese: 交叉，十字；十字架，十字形物
detailed_translations.english: an upright post of wood with another crossing it near the top, that people in the past were fastened to with nails and left to die on as a punishment
if two or more roads, lines, etc cross, or if one crosses another, they go across each other

detailed_translations.chinese: 交叉的，相反的；乖戾的；生气的
detailed_translations.english: angry or annoyed

name: document
trans: A document is a written or printed record of information, often referring to an official or legal paper.

sentences.english: She produces legal documents for a downtown Seattle law firm.
sentences.chinese: 她为西雅图市区的一家法律事务所撰写法律文件。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of paper that has official information on it
to write about something, film it, or take photographs of it, in order to record information about it

name: draft
trans: A draft is a preliminary or rough version of a written document or plan.

sentences.english: the rough draft of his new novel
sentences.chinese: 他的新小说的草稿

sentences.english: I read the first draft and thought it was very good.
sentences.chinese: 我读了第一稿，觉得非常好。

sentences.english: All parties eventually approved the final draft (= finished form ) of the peace treaty.
sentences.chinese: 各方最后都同意了和平条约的终稿。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of writing or a plan that is not yet in its finished form
to write a plan, letter, report etc that will need to be changed before it is in its finished form

name: dust
trans: Dust is tiny, dry particles of earth, dirt, or other matter that can float in the air and settle on surfaces.

sentences.english: All the furniture was covered in dust .
sentences.chinese: 所有的家具都蒙上了灰尘。

sentences.english: a thick layer of dust
sentences.chinese: 厚厚的一层灰尘

sentences.english: There’s not a speck of dust in the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 厨房里一尘不染。

sentences.english: Dust particles floated in the sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 阳光里飘浮着尘埃颗粒。

sentences.english: A sudden breeze sent motes of dust (= small bits of dust ) dancing in the air.
sentences.chinese: 突然刮起一阵微风吹得灰尘飞扬。

detailed_translations.english: dry powder consisting of extremely small bits of dirt that is in buildings on furniture, floors etc if they are not kept clean

name: expert
trans: An expert is a person who has extensive knowledge or skills in a particular field or subject.

sentences.english: ...a yoga expert.
sentences.chinese: …一位瑜伽专家。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has a special skill or special knowledge of a subject, gained as a result of training or experience

name: floor
trans: A floor is the level surface of a room on which people walk and furniture is placed.

sentences.english: a polished wooden floor
sentences.chinese: 上过蜡的木地板

sentences.english: a puddle of water on the kitchen floor
sentences.chinese: 厨房地面上的一摊水

sentences.english: a warehouse that has 410,000 square feet of floor space
sentences.chinese: 楼面面积为41万平方英尺的仓库

detailed_translations.chinese: 地板，地面；楼层；基底；议员席
detailed_translations.english: the flat surface that you stand on inside a building

detailed_translations.chinese: 铺地板；打倒，击倒；（被困难）难倒
detailed_translations.english: to hit someone so hard that they fall down

name: god
trans: A god is a supernatural being or spirit worshipped by people, often considered to have power and control over the world and its inhabitants.

sentences.english: Prayer is a way of talking to God.
sentences.chinese: 祈祷是同上帝交流的一种方式。

detailed_translations.english: the spirit or  being  who Christians, Jews, Muslims etc pray to, and who they believe created the universe

name: golf
trans: Golf is a sport played on a large open-air course, in which players use clubs to hit a small ball into a series of holes.

sentences.english: He plays golf on Sundays.
sentences.chinese: 他星期天都去打高尔夫球。

sentences.english: a round of golf
sentences.chinese: 一场高尔夫球赛

detailed_translations.chinese: 高尔夫球；高尔夫球运动
detailed_translations.english: a game in which the players hit a small white ball into holes in the ground with a set of golf clubs, using as few hits as possible

name: habit
trans: A habit is a regular tendency or practice, often referring to a behavior that is difficult to change.

sentences.english: Regular exercise is a good habit.
sentences.chinese: 经常锻炼是个好习惯。

sentences.english: Thinking negatively can become a habit.
sentences.chinese: 消极的思维方式会成为一种习惯。

sentences.english: She has a habit of playing with her hair when she’s nervous.
sentences.chinese: 她有一个习惯，一紧张就拨弄自己的头发。

sentences.english: Some people drink alcohol as much from habit as from desire.
sentences.chinese: 有些人喝酒既是因为想喝，也是出于习惯。

detailed_translations.english: something that you do regularly or usually, often without thinking about it because you have done it so many times before

name: iron
trans: Iron is a chemical element with the symbol Fe, commonly used to make metal objects or tools.

sentences.english: the iron and steel industry
sentences.chinese: 钢铁工业

sentences.english: a driveway with large iron gates
sentences.chinese: 安装了大铁门的私家车道

sentences.english: the absorption of iron from food
sentences.chinese: 对食物中铁的吸收

sentences.english: ...a man of icy nerve and iron will.
sentences.chinese: …一个头脑冷静、意志坚强的男人。

detailed_translations.english: a common hard metal that is used to make steel, is  magnetic  , and is found in very small quantities in food and blood. It is a chemical  element  : symbol Fe
to make clothes smooth using an iron
You can use iron to describe the character or behaviour of someone who is very firm in their decisions and actions, or who can control their feelings well

name: judge
trans: A judge is a person appointed or elected to decide on legal matters in a court of law.

sentences.english: You should never judge a person by their looks.
sentences.chinese: 决不要以貌取人。

sentences.english: Judge us on the improvements we make in the economy.
sentences.chinese: 请根据我们在经济方面取得的进步来评价我们。

sentences.english: The therapist judged that Margaret had made a serious attempt to kill herself.
sentences.chinese: 治疗专家断定玛格丽特曾真的企图自杀。

sentences.english: pollutants that were judged hazardous to human health
sentences.chinese: 被认为对人体健康有害的污染物

sentences.english: I am in no position to judge whether what she is doing is right or wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我无权评判她在做的事是对是错。

sentences.english: The economic results of the reforms are very difficult to judge.
sentences.chinese: 这些改革所带来的经济成效很难评价。

sentences.english: The likelihood of future bombs was impossible to judge.
sentences.chinese: 未来发生爆炸案的可能性无法预测。

sentences.english: We judge the success of a product by the number of sales it brings in.
sentences.chinese: 我们以销量来评价一种产品成功与否。

sentences.english: His conduct, judged objectively by what he has done, is dishonest.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为，从他所做的这一切客观地来评价，是不诚实的。

sentences.english: Robert wanted to go and help him, but judged it best to stay where he was.
sentences.chinese: 罗伯特想过去帮他，但考虑之后还是觉得待在原地为妙。

sentences.english: Do not judge her too harshly, as she was very young at the time.
sentences.chinese: 对她的评价不要太苛刻，毕竟那时候她还很年轻。

detailed_translations.english: to form or give an opinion about someone or something after thinking carefully about all the information you know about them
the official in control of a court, who decides how criminals should be punished

name: knife
trans: A knife is a tool or weapon with a sharp blade used for cutting or slicing.

sentences.english: a knife and fork
sentences.chinese: 一副刀叉

sentences.english: Some young people are carrying knives to defend themselves.
sentences.chinese: 一些年轻人带着刀子防身。

sentences.english: a kitchen knife
sentences.chinese: 厨房用刀

sentences.english: Use a sharp knife to cut the melon into sections.
sentences.chinese: 用快刀把瓜切成块。

detailed_translations.english: a metal blade fixed into a handle, used for cutting or as a weapon
to put a knife into someone’s body

name: landscape
trans: A landscape is a large area of land with a particular type of scenery or natural features.

sentences.english: the beauty of the New England landscape
sentences.chinese: 新英格兰风光之美

detailed_translations.english: an area of countryside or land of a particular type, used especially when talking about its appearance
to make a park, garden etc look attractive and interesting by changing its design, and by planting trees and bushes etc

name: league
trans: A league is a group of sports teams or organizations that compete against each other.

sentences.english: the National Socialist League
sentences.chinese: 国家社会主义联盟

detailed_translations.english: a group of people or countries who have joined together because they have similar aims, political beliefs etc

name: mail
trans: Mail is the system used for sending letters, packages, and other postal items through a postal service.

sentences.english: You shouldn’t read other people’s mail.
sentences.chinese: 你不应该看别人的信件。

sentences.english: He found a mountain of mail waiting for him.
sentences.chinese: 他发现有堆积如山的邮件等着他处理。

sentences.english: She promised to forward my mail to my new address (= send it from your old home or office to your new one ) .
sentences.chinese: 她答应把我的邮件转寄到我的新地址。

sentences.english: He gets sacks of fan mail (= letters from people who admire him ) .
sentences.chinese: 他收到成堆仰慕者的来信。

sentences.english: The weekly newsletter is mailed to women all over the country.
sentences.chinese: 每周一期的简报邮寄给全国各地的妇女。

detailed_translations.english: the letters and packages that are delivered to you
to send a letter or package to someone

name: mess
trans: A mess is a state of disorder or confusion, or a dirty or untidy place.

sentences.english: What a mess!
sentences.chinese: 太乱了！

sentences.english: Sorry – the place is a bit of a mess .
sentences.chinese: 对不起——这里有些乱。

sentences.english: When I got home, the house was a complete mess .
sentences.chinese: 我回到家时，屋子里一片狼藉。

sentences.english: You can make cookies if you promise not to make a mess in the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 如果你答应不把厨房搞得乱七八糟，你可以去做甜饼。

sentences.english: She hates mess.
sentences.chinese: 她讨厌到处乱糟糟的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 凌乱状态，混乱的局面；困境
detailed_translations.english: if there is a mess somewhere or a place is a mess, things there are dirty or not neatly arranged

detailed_translations.chinese: 弄糟， 弄脏， 搞乱
detailed_translations.english: to make something look untidy or dirty

name: native
trans: Native refers to something or someone that is from a particular place by birth or origin.

sentences.english: Singapore has many native species of palm.
sentences.chinese: 新加坡有很多土生的棕榈树种。

sentences.english: You can always tell the difference between the tourists and the natives.
sentences.chinese: 游客与当地人之间的区别一望即知。

detailed_translations.english: growing, living, produced etc in one particular place
someone who lives in a place all the time or has lived there a long time

name: opening
trans: An opening is a hole, gap or space that allows entry or access.

sentences.english: the opening match of the season
sentences.chinese: 本赛季的首场比赛

sentences.english: the opening chapter of the book
sentences.chinese: 本书的第一章

sentences.english: at the opening of the trial
sentences.chinese: 审判伊始

detailed_translations.english: first or beginning
the beginning or first part of something

name: parent
trans: A parent is a person who has a child or children.

sentences.english: Children under 14 should be accompanied by a parent.
sentences.chinese: 14 岁以下儿童须由一位家长陪同。

sentences.english: The eggs are guarded by both parents.
sentences.chinese: 那些蛋由两只亲鸟共同守护着。

sentences.english: Melissa’s spending the weekend at her parents’ house.
sentences.chinese: 梅利莎正在父母家度周末。

detailed_translations.english: the father or mother of a person or animal

name: pattern
trans: A pattern is a repeated design or shape.

sentences.english: Weather patterns have changed in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 气候模式近年已经发生了变化。

sentences.english: A general pattern began to emerge .
sentences.chinese: 一个总体模式开始显现。

sentences.english: Their descriptions seemed to follow a set pattern (= always develop in the same way ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的描述似乎依据固定的模式。

sentences.english: His behavior fits a pattern of violent acts.
sentences.chinese: 他的举动符合暴力行为的模式。

sentences.english: a dress pattern
sentences.chinese: 连衣裙的纸样

detailed_translations.english: the regular way in which something happens, develops, or is done

name: pin
trans: A pin is a small, pointed object used to fasten things together.

sentences.english: a diamond pin
sentences.chinese: 一枚钻石胸针

sentences.english: He pinned the name tag on his jacket.
sentences.chinese: 他把姓名牌别在自己的短外套上。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of metal, sometimes containing jewels, that you fasten to your clothes to wear as a decoration
to fasten something somewhere, or to join two things together, using a pin

name: pool
trans: A pool is a small body of still water, often for swimming or as a reservoir.

sentences.english: They have a nice pool in their backyard.
sentences.chinese: 他们后院有个漂亮的游泳池。

sentences.english: a shallow pool suitable for children
sentences.chinese: 适合儿童的浅水池

sentences.english: pools of water with tiny fish in them
sentences.chinese: 有小鱼的一个个水池

detailed_translations.english: a hole or container that has been specially made and filled with water so that people can swim or play in it

name: pound
trans: A pound is a unit of weight measurement equal to 16 ounces.

sentences.english: They spent over a thousand pounds.
sentences.chinese: 他们花了一千多英镑。

sentences.english: a multi-million pound business
sentences.chinese: 一笔几百万英镑的生意

sentences.english: a five pound note
sentences.chinese: 五英镑的纸币

sentences.english: She pounded the corn kernels.
sentences.chinese: 她捣碎了玉米粒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 英镑；重击，重击声；兽栏；拘留所
detailed_translations.english: the standard unit of money in Britain, which is divided into 100 pence
If you pound something, you crush it into a paste or a powder or into very small pieces

name: request
trans: A request is an act of asking for something.

sentences.english: They have made an urgent request for international aid.
sentences.chinese: 他们紧急请求国际援助。

sentences.english: To request more information, please call our toll free number.
sentences.chinese: 欲知详情，请拨打我们的免费电话。

detailed_translations.english: a polite or formal demand for something
to ask for something in a polite or formal way

name: salary
trans: A salary is a fixed amount of money paid regularly for work done.

sentences.english: The average salary for a teacher is $39,000 a year.
sentences.chinese: 教师的平均工资是39,000美元一年。

detailed_translations.english: money that you receive as payment from the organization you work for, usually paid to you every month

name: shame
trans: Shame is a feeling of guilt or embarrassment caused by doing something wrong or inappropriate.

sentences.english: He felt a deep sense of shame.
sentences.chinese: 他深深地感到羞愧。

sentences.english: Maria blushed with shame.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽亚羞得脸都红了。

sentences.english: (= it made her feel ashamed ) , she gained back all the weight she’d lost.
sentences.chinese: 让她感到惭愧的是，她减掉的体重全又长回来了。

sentences.english: He’s brought shame on the whole family.
sentences.chinese: 他使全家蒙羞。

sentences.english: (= it should not make you feel ashamed ) saying ‘I don’t know’.
sentences.chinese: 说一句"我不知道”也没什么可难为情的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 羞耻，羞愧；憾事，带来耻辱的人
detailed_translations.english: the feeling you have when you feel guilty and embarrassed because you, or someone who is close to you, have done something wrong
to make someone feel ashamed

name: shelter
trans: A shelter is a place that provides protection from bad weather or danger.

sentences.english: The men took shelter in a bombed-out farmhouse.
sentences.chinese: 那些男人躲在一间被炸毁的农舍里。

sentences.english: All around me, people were running for shelter .
sentences.chinese: 我周围的人都在奔跑着寻找地方躲避。

sentences.english: ...a wooden house, sheltered by a low pointed roof.
sentences.chinese: …一座由低矮的尖屋顶遮蔽的木房子。

detailed_translations.english: protection from danger or from wind, rain, hot sun etc
If a place or thing is sheltered by something, it is protected by that thing from wind and rain

name: shoe
trans: A shoe is a covering for the foot, typically made of leather or rubber.

sentences.english: I sat down and took off my shoes and socks.
sentences.chinese: 我坐下来脱掉鞋子和袜子。

sentences.english: What size shoes do you take?
sentences.chinese: 你穿几号的鞋子？

detailed_translations.english: something that you wear to cover your feet, made of leather or some other strong material

name: silver
trans: Silver is a precious metal that has a shiny, white-grey color.

sentences.english: The silver spoon tarnished.
sentences.chinese: 银匙失去光泽了。

sentences.english: Her teeth were capped with silver.
sentences.chinese: 她的牙齿是包了银的。

sentences.english: The workers parted gold from silver in the workshop.
sentences.chinese: 在车间里工人们把金子从银子中提炼出来。

name: tackle
trans: To tackle is to confront or deal with a difficult problem or task.

sentences.english: There is more than one way to tackle the problem.
sentences.chinese: 解决这个问题不止一个办法。

sentences.english: fishing tackle
sentences.chinese: 渔具

detailed_translations.english: to try to deal with a difficult problem
the equipment used in some sports and activities, especially fishing

name: tank
trans: A tank is a large container for storing liquids or gases.

sentences.english: The water tank is leaking.
sentences.chinese: 水箱在漏水。

sentences.english: Somehow the chemical got from a storage tank into water supplies.
sentences.chinese: 不知怎么的，这种化学物从储存箱进入了供水系统。

sentences.english: the plane’s fuel tank
sentences.chinese: 飞机的油箱

detailed_translations.english: a large container for storing liquid or gas

name: trust
trans: Trust is a belief or confidence in the reliability, truth, or ability of someone or something.

sentences.english: At first there was a lack of trust between them.
sentences.chinese: 起初，他们之间缺乏信任。

sentences.english: an agreement made on the basis of mutual trust
sentences.chinese: 在相互信任的基础上达成的一项协议

sentences.english: You betrayed your father’s trust (= did something bad even though he trusted you ).
sentences.chinese: 你辜负了你父亲对你的信任。

sentences.english: I just don’t trust him.
sentences.chinese: 我就是不信任他。

sentences.english: The money your father left you will be held in trust until you are 21.
sentences.chinese: 你父亲留给你的钱将被托管到你满21岁。

detailed_translations.english: a strong belief in the honesty, goodness etc of someone or something
to believe that someone is honest or will not do anything bad or wrong

name: assist
trans: To assist is to help or support someone in doing something.

sentences.english: The family decided to assist me with my chores.
sentences.chinese: 家人决定分担我的琐事。

sentences.english: The family decided to assist me with my chores.
sentences.chinese: 家人决定分担我的琐事。

detailed_translations.english: to help someone to do something
If you assist someone, you help them to do a job or task by doing part of the work for them

name: bake
trans: To bake is to cook food in an oven using dry heat.

sentences.english: I’m baking some bread.
sentences.chinese: 我在烤一些面包。

sentences.english: baked potatoes
sentences.chinese: 烤马铃薯

sentences.english: Bake at 250 degrees for 20 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 用250度的温度烤20分钟。

sentences.english: The bricks were baked in the sun.
sentences.chinese: 砖块放在太阳光下晒硬。

detailed_translations.english: to cook something using dry heat, in an oven

name: bar
trans: A bar is a place where alcoholic beverages are sold and consumed.

sentences.english: The public bar was crowded.
sentences.chinese: 大众酒吧间里人很多。

sentences.english: a candy bar
sentences.chinese: 一根糖果棒

sentences.english: houses with bars across the windows
sentences.chinese: 窗户上钉有铁条的房屋

detailed_translations.english: one of the rooms inside a pub

name: bell
trans: A bell is a hollow, usually metal, cup-shaped object that produces a ringing sound when struck.

sentences.english: church bells
sentences.chinese: 教堂的钟

detailed_translations.english: a piece of electrical equipment that makes a ringing sound, used as a signal or to get someone’s attention

name: bike
trans: A bike is a short form of bicycle, which is a vehicle with two wheels that is powered by pedals.

sentences.english: Let’s go for a bike ride.
sentences.chinese: 我们去骑会儿自行车吧。

sentences.english: She bikes to work every day.
sentences.chinese: 她每天骑自行车上班。

detailed_translations.english: a bicycle
to ride a bicycle

name: blame
trans: Blame is to hold someone responsible for a fault or mistake.

sentences.english: Don’t blame me – it’s not my fault.
sentences.chinese: 别来怪我——又不是我的错。

sentences.english: I blame his mother. She does everything for him.
sentences.chinese: 怪他母亲不好，她什么事都要为他做。

detailed_translations.english: to say or think that someone or something is responsible for something bad

name: boy
trans: A boy is a young male person.

sentences.english: The boys wanted to play football.
sentences.chinese: 男孩子们想踢足球。

sentences.english: boys and girls aged 11–18
sentences.chinese: 11到18岁之间的男孩和女孩

sentences.english: What a polite little boy (=  young male child  ) you are.
sentences.chinese: 你真是个有礼貌的小男孩。

sentences.english: Come on, Timmy, act like a big boy (=  an older boy  ) now.
sentences.chinese: 行了，蒂米，要有大男孩的样子了。

sentences.english: Good boy!
sentences.chinese: 好伙计！

detailed_translations.english: a male child, or a male person in general

name: brick
trans: A brick is a rectangular block made of clay or other materials used for building walls.

sentences.english: a brick wall
sentences.chinese: 砖墙

sentences.english: a house made of brick
sentences.chinese: 砖房

sentences.english: Protesters attacked the police with stones and bricks.
sentences.chinese: 抗议者用石头和砖块袭击警察。

detailed_translations.english: a hard block of baked clay used for building walls, houses etc

name: chair
trans: A chair is a piece of furniture designed for one person to sit on, typically with a back and four legs.

sentences.english: a kitchen chair
sentences.chinese: 厨房椅

sentences.english: They bought a new table and chairs.
sentences.chinese: 他们买了一套新的桌椅。

sentences.english: One of the chair legs was broken.
sentences.chinese: 椅子有一条腿断了。

sentences.english: Address your questions to the chair, please.
sentences.chinese: 请向主席提出你的问题。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of furniture for one person to sit on, which has a back, a seat, and four legs

name: closet
trans: A closet is a small room or space used for storing clothes or other personal items.

sentences.english: a closet full of beautiful clothes
sentences.chinese: 满是漂亮衣服的壁橱

detailed_translations.chinese: 壁橱；议事室，密室；小房间
detailed_translations.english: a cupboard built into the wall of a room from the floor to the ceiling
to shut someone in a room away from other people in order to discuss something private, to be alone etc

name: clue
trans: A clue is a piece of information that helps solve a problem or mystery.

sentences.english: Police have found a vital clue .
sentences.chinese: 警方发现了至关重要的线索。

sentences.english: Archaeological evidence will provide clues about what the building was used for.
sentences.chinese: 考古证据将为这幢建筑的用途提供线索。

sentences.english: a desperate search for clues
sentences.chinese: 拼命寻找线索

detailed_translations.english: an object or piece of information that helps someone solve a crime or mystery

name: collar
trans: A collar is a band of material worn around the neck, often on a shirt or jacket.

sentences.english: He grabbed me by the collar.
sentences.chinese: 他抓住我的衣领。

sentences.english: He loosened his collar and tie .
sentences.chinese: 他松开了领子和领带。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a shirt, coat etc that fits around your neck, and is usually folded over

detailed_translations.chinese: 抓住；给…上领子；给…套上颈圈
detailed_translations.english: to catch someone and hold them so that they cannot escape

name: comment
trans: A comment is a statement or opinion expressing thoughts or feelings about something.

sentences.english: Have you any comment to make about the cause of the disaster?
sentences.chinese: 你对发生灾难的原因有何评论？

sentences.english: The results are a clear comment on government education policy.
sentences.chinese: 这些结果是对政府教育政策明显的批评。

detailed_translations.english: an opinion that you express about someone or something

name: conference
trans: A conference is a meeting of people to discuss or exchange ideas on a particular topic.

sentences.english: Representatives from over 100 countries attended the International Peace Conference in Geneva.
sentences.chinese: 来自一百多个国家的代表出席了在日内瓦举行的国际和平大会。

detailed_translations.english: a large formal meeting where a lot of people discuss important matters such as business, politics, or science, especially for several days

name: devil
trans: The devil is a supernatural being often associated with evil or mischief.

sentences.english: What on earth is wrong with the poor devil?
sentences.chinese: 这可怜的家伙到底怎么了？

detailed_translations.chinese: 魔鬼；撒旦；家伙；恶棍；淘气鬼；冒失鬼
detailed_translations.english: the most powerful evil spiritin some religions, especially in Christianity

detailed_translations.chinese: 虐待，折磨；（用扯碎机）扯碎；（替作家，律师等）做助手；抹辣味料烤制或煎煮

name: diet
trans: A diet is the kinds of food that a person, animal, or community habitually eats.

sentences.english: She doesn’t eat a very healthy diet.
sentences.chinese: 她的饮食不是很健康。

sentences.english: It is important to have a balanced diet.
sentences.chinese: 饮食均衡很重要。

sentences.english: Rice is the staple diet (= the main food that a group of people usually eat ) .
sentences.chinese: 大米是主食。

detailed_translations.english: the kind of food that a person or animal eats each day

name: fear
trans: Fear is a feeling of being afraid or scared of something.

sentences.english: a fear of flying
sentences.chinese: 害怕坐飞机

sentences.english: Fearing violence, the group asked for police protection.
sentences.chinese: 该团体担心发生暴力事件，所以请求警方保护。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling you get when you are afraid or worried that something bad is going to happen
to feel afraid or worried that something bad may happen

name: fuel
trans: Fuel is a substance that is burned to produce energy, such as gasoline or coal.

sentences.english: Coal is one of the cheapest fuels.
sentences.chinese: 煤是最廉价的燃料之一。

detailed_translations.english: a substance such as coal, gas, or oil that can be burned to produce heat or energy
if you fuel a vehicle, or if it fuels up, fuel is put into it

name: glove
trans: A glove is a piece of clothing worn on the hand for warmth or protection.

sentences.english: a pair of gloves
sentences.chinese: 一副手套

sentences.english: boxing gloves
sentences.chinese: 拳击手套

detailed_translations.english: a piece of clothing that you wear on your hand in order to protect it or keep it warm

name: jacket
trans: A jacket is a piece of clothing worn over the upper body, often for warmth or style.

sentences.english: He unzipped his jacket.
sentences.chinese: 他拉开夹克衫的拉链。

sentences.english: The bitter wind cut through his jacket.
sentences.chinese: 刺骨的冷风吹透了他的夹克衫。

sentences.english: When I grew out of my jacket,I gave it to my little brother.
sentences.chinese: 我长得穿不下我的夹克衫了，便把它给我弟弟穿。

detailed_translations.english: a short light coat

name: lunch
trans: Lunch is a meal eaten in the middle of the day.

sentences.english: What’s for lunch?
sentences.chinese: 午饭吃什么？

detailed_translations.english: a meal eaten in the middle of the day

name: monitor
trans: A monitor is a device used to display or measure information, such as a computer monitor or a heart monitor.

sentences.english: a heart monitor
sentences.chinese: 心脏监测仪

detailed_translations.chinese: 班长；监视器，检测器；显示器
detailed_translations.english: a television or part of a computer with a screen, on which you can see pictures or information
to carefully watch and check a situation in order to see how it changes over a period of time

name: mortgage
trans: A mortgage is a loan taken out to buy property or real estate, with the property serving as collateral.

sentences.english: Your building society or bank will help arrange a mortgage.
sentences.chinese: 你加入的购房互助协会或银行将会给你安排抵押贷款。

sentences.english: They’ve taken out a 30 year mortgage (= they will pay for their house over a period of 30 years ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们办理了一笔30年期的抵押贷款。

sentences.english: We decided to use Fred’s redundancy money to pay off the mortgage (= pay back all the money we borrowed for a mortgage ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们决定用弗雷德的遣散费来偿清抵押贷款。

sentences.english: Mortgage rates are set to rise again in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 抵押贷款利率到春季肯定还要上涨。

sentences.english: She was having trouble meeting her mortgage payments .
sentences.chinese: 她还抵押贷款有困难。

detailed_translations.english: a legal arrangement by which you borrow money from a bank or similar organization in order to buy a house, and pay back the money over a period of years

if you mortgage your home, land, or property, you borrow money, usually from a bank, and if you cannot pay back the money within a particular period of time, the bank has the right to sell your property in order to get the money you owe it

name: nurse
trans: A nurse is a healthcare professional who provides medical care and support to patients.

sentences.english: The nurse is coming to give you an injection.
sentences.chinese: 护士会来给你打针。

sentences.english: The school nurse sent Sara home.
sentences.chinese: 学校的护士送萨拉回家。

sentences.english: a male nurse
sentences.chinese: 男护士

sentences.english: a senior nurse
sentences.chinese: 高级护士

sentences.english: a student nurse (= someone who is learning to be a nurse )
sentences.chinese: 实习护士

sentences.english: a psychiatric nurse (= a nurse for people who are mentally ill )
sentences.chinese: 精神病院护士

sentences.english: He’s been nursing an elderly relative.
sentences.chinese: 他一直在照顾一位年老的亲戚。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to look after people who are ill or injured, usually in a hospital
to look after someone who is ill or injured

name: pace
trans: Pace is the speed or rate at which something moves or progresses.

sentences.english: He quickened his pace , longing to be home.
sentences.chinese: 他加快步伐，盼望着早点回到家中。

sentences.english: Traffic slowed to a walking pace.
sentences.chinese: 车流速度减缓，犹如步行。

sentences.english: I found Mark at the hospital, pacing restlessly up and down.
sentences.chinese: 我看见马克在医院里焦躁不安地踱来踱去。

detailed_translations.english: the speed at which someone walks, runs, or moves
to walk first in one direction and then in another many times, especially because you are nervous

name: panic
trans: Panic is a sudden feeling of fear or anxiety that causes people to act in a frantic or irrational way.

sentences.english: Her face distorted in panic.
sentences.chinese: 她的脸因恐慌而变相了。

sentences.english: The panic-stricken fled in all directions.
sentences.chinese: 惊慌的人群向四面八方逃去。

sentences.english: They ascribed courage to me for something I did out of sheer panic.
sentences.chinese: 由于我纯粹因惊慌而做的事，他们认为我很有勇气。

name: peak
trans: A peak is the highest point of something, such as a mountain or a wave.

sentences.english: snow-capped mountain peaks
sentences.chinese: 白雪覆盖的山顶

sentences.english: jagged peaks
sentences.chinese: 嶙峋的山峰

sentences.english: It was a time of peak demand for the product.
sentences.chinese: 那是对该产品需求最旺的时期。

detailed_translations.english: the sharply pointed top of a mountain
used to talk about the best, highest, or greatest level or amount of something

name: plane
trans: A plane is a vehicle that is designed for air travel and has wings and one or more engines.

sentences.english: It is a big airline with a large fleet of planes.
sentences.chinese: 这是一家大航空公司，拥有庞大的机群。

sentences.english: It’s much quicker to go by plane.
sentences.chinese: 乘飞机去会快很多。

sentences.english: She slept on the plane.
sentences.chinese: 她在飞机上睡着了。

detailed_translations.english: a vehicle that flies in the air and has wings and at least one engine

name: reward
trans: A reward is something given in return for good behavior or work, often as a form of incentive or recognition.

sentences.english: The school has a system of rewards and punishments to encourage good behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 学校有奖惩制度以鼓励良好行为。

sentences.english: The club’s directors rewarded him with a free season ticket.
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部的董事们奖给他一张免费季票。

detailed_translations.english: something that you get because you have done something good or helpful or have worked hard
to give something to someone because they have done something good or helpful or have worked fo

name: row
trans: A row is a line of things arranged side by side, often in a straight line or sequence.

sentences.english: a family row
sentences.chinese: 家庭争吵

sentences.english: He had just had a row with his wife.
sentences.chinese: 他刚刚和妻子吵了一架。

detailed_translations.english: a short angry argument, especially between people who know each other well

name: sandwich
trans: A sandwich is a food item made by placing filling (such as meat or vegetables) between two slices of bread.

sentences.english: Carefully split the sponge ring, then sandwich the two halves together with whipped cream.
sentences.chinese: 小心地切开海绵蛋糕圈，然后在两半中间夹上生奶油。

detailed_translations.chinese: 夹入；挤进；把做成三明治
detailed_translations.english: If you sandwich two things together with something else, you put that other thing between them. If you sandwich one thing between two other things, you put it between them.
two pieces of bread with cheese, meat, cooked egg etc between them

name: shock
trans: Shock is a sudden, intense feeling of surprise or disbelief, often caused by something unexpected.

sentences.english: The hatred in her voice shocked him.
sentences.chinese: 她语气中的仇恨让他震惊。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel very surprised and upset, and unable to believe what has happened

name: spite
trans: Spite is a feeling of resentment or ill-will towards someone, often leading to harmful or negative actions.

sentences.english: We went out in spite of the rain.
sentences.chinese: 尽管下着雨，我们还是出去了。

sentences.english: Kelly loved her husband in spite of the fact that he drank too much.
sentences.chinese: 虽然丈夫酗酒，凯莉仍然爱着他。

sentences.english: She broke it just out of spite.
sentences.chinese: 她就是出于恶意把它打破的。

sentences.english: The neighbours throw things over the garden wall just to spite us.
sentences.chinese: 邻居把东西扔过花园围墙，故意和我们作对。

detailed_translations.english: without being affected or prevented by something
to deliberately annoy or upset someone

name: spray
trans: Spray is a liquid or mist that is dispersed in the air in small droplets, often used for cleaning or applying chemicals.

sentences.english: spray from the waves
sentences.chinese: 海浪溅起的水雾

sentences.english: a new hair styling spray
sentences.chinese: 一种新的定型喷发剂

sentences.english: Most farmers use pesticide sprays.
sentences.chinese: 大多数农民都使用喷雾杀虫剂。

sentences.english: She sprayed herself with perfume.
sentences.chinese: 她往身上喷了香水。

detailed_translations.english: water in very small drops that is blown from the sea etc or sent up by vehicles on a wet road
to force liquid out of a container so that it comes out in a stream of very small drops and covers an area

name: surprise
trans: A surprise is something unexpected or sudden that happens to someone.

sentences.english: His strange question surprised her.
sentences.chinese: 他那奇怪的问题令她感到意外。

sentences.english: I didn’t know you two knew each other. Mind you, it doesn’t surprise me .
sentences.chinese: 我不知道你们俩认识。 尽管如此，我并不感到意外。

sentences.english: What surprised me most was that she didn’t seem to care.
sentences.chinese: 最令我感到意外的是，她好像毫不在乎。

sentences.english: The man had a look of surprise on his face.
sentences.chinese: 那人脸上一副惊讶的表情。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使诧异,使惊异,使感到意外
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel surprised
the feeling you have when something unexpected or unusual happens

name: till
trans: A till is a cash register or a box used to store money.

sentences.english: You keep as much money as you need in the till to run your operations.
sentences.chinese: 你做业务要储备足够的钱。

detailed_translations.chinese: [地理][水文] 冰碛；放钱的抽屉；备用现金
detailed_translations.english: money in the till is money that a company or organization has
until
to prepare land for growing crops

name: transition
trans: A transition is the process of changing from one state or condition to another.

sentences.english: Making the transition from youth to adulthood can be very painful.
sentences.chinese: 从青少年过渡到成年有时是一个非常痛苦的过程。

sentences.english: a society that is in transition
sentences.chinese: 一个正在转型的社会

sentences.english: the period of transition to full democracy
sentences.chinese: 向全面民主的过渡时期

detailed_translations.english: when something changes from one form or state to another

name: weekend
trans: The weekend is the period of time between the end of the work or school week and the beginning of the next one, usually Saturday and Sunday.

sentences.english: Are you doing anything nice this weekend?
sentences.chinese: 这个周末你有什么好的安排？

sentences.english: Tony has been unwell over the weekend (= during the weekend ).
sentences.chinese: 托尼这个周末身体不舒服。

sentences.english: We’re going to Paris for a long weekend (= Saturday and Sunday, and also Friday or Monday, or both ).
sentences.chinese: 我们要到巴黎去度一个长周末。

detailed_translations.chinese: 周末，周末休假；周末聚会
detailed_translations.english: Saturday and Sunday, especially considered as time when you do not work
to spend the weekend somewhere

name: welcome
trans: To welcome someone is to greet them in a friendly way and make them feel comfortable.

sentences.english: I had the feeling I wasn’t really welcome.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉到我其实不受欢迎。

sentences.english: I didn’t feel welcome in the club.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得我在俱乐部里不受欢迎。

sentences.english: Mary made us very welcome.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽让我们感觉很受欢迎。

sentences.english: We try to make the new students feel welcome.
sentences.chinese: 我们尽量让新同学感到自己是受欢迎的。

detailed_translations.english: if someone is welcome in a place, other people are glad that they are there
the way in which you greet someone when they arrive at a place
to say hello in a friendly way to someone who has just arrived
the way in which you greet someone when they arrive at a place

name: yard
trans: A yard is an area of land next to a building, usually used for outdoor activities.

sentences.english: a hundred yards away
sentences.chinese: 100码外

sentences.english: an area of 9,000 square yards
sentences.chinese: 面积为9,000平方码的一片区域

detailed_translations.chinese: 院子；码（英制中丈量长度单位，1码=3英尺）；庭院；帆桁
detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring length, equal to three feet or 0.91 metres

name: alarm
trans: An alarm is a device that makes a loud noise to warn people of danger or to wake them up.

sentences.english: I forgot to set the burglar alarm.
sentences.chinese: 我忘记打开防盗警报器了。

sentences.english: Car alarms are always going off in the street.
sentences.chinese: 街上总有汽车警报器在响。

sentences.english: a sophisticated alarm system
sentences.chinese: 精密的警报系统

sentences.english: We could not see what had alarmed him.
sentences.chinese: 我们不明白是什么吓着他了。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that makes a loud noise to warn you of danger
If something alarms you, it makes you afraid or anxious that something unpleasant or dangerous might happen

name: bend
trans: To bend is to curve or to change the shape of something by applying pressure.

sentences.english: Lee bent and kissed her.
sentences.chinese: 李俯下身来亲她。

sentences.english: She bent her head.
sentences.chinese: 她低下头。

sentences.english: Bend your knees, but keep your back straight.
sentences.chinese: 膝盖弯曲，背部保持挺直。

detailed_translations.english: to move part of your body so that it is not straight or so that you are not upright
to become curved and no longer flat or straight
a curved part of something, especially a road or river

name: bicycle
trans: A bicycle is a two-wheeled vehicle that is powered by pedaling.

sentences.english: Can James ride a bicycle yet?
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯会骑自行车了吗？

detailed_translations.english: a vehicle with two wheels that you ride by pushing its pedals with your feet

name: bite
trans: To bite is to use your teeth to break, cut, or grip something.

sentences.english: The dog bit him and made his hand bleed.
sentences.chinese: 那只狗把他的手咬出血了。

sentences.english: The dog’s been badly bitten by fleas.
sentences.chinese: 狗被跳蚤咬得很厉害。

detailed_translations.english: to use your teeth to cut, crush, or chew something

name: blind
trans: Blind means unable to see, or without vision.

sentences.english: Doctors think he will go blind.
sentences.chinese: 医生们认为他会失明。

sentences.english: blind faith/obedience
sentences.chinese: 盲目的信念；盲从

detailed_translations.english: not able to see

name: bottle
trans: A bottle is a container with a narrow neck used for storing liquids.

sentences.english: an empty bottle
sentences.chinese: 一个空瓶子

detailed_translations.english: a container with a narrow top for keeping liquids in, usually made of plastic or glass
to put a liquid, especially wine or beer, into a bottle after you have made it

name: cable
trans: A cable is a thick, strong wire used for transmitting electricity, data, or audio and video signals.

sentences.english: The miners rode a conveyance attached to a cable made of braided steel wire.
sentences.chinese: 矿工们乘坐连着钢索的缆车。

sentences.english: cables and switches for computers
sentences.chinese: 电脑的缆线和开关

sentences.english: She sent a cable to her mother.
sentences.chinese: 她给母亲发了封电报。

detailed_translations.english: a thick strong metal rope used on ships, to support bridges etc

name: candle
trans: A candle is a stick of wax with a wick that can be lit and used for illumination or decoration.

sentences.english: The candle flickered in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 烛光在风中闪烁不定。

sentences.english: The candle flickered and then went out.
sentences.chinese: 一开始蜡烛摇曳不定， 然后就灭了。

sentences.english: When the candle was only half an inch high it flickered out and the room became dark.
sentences.chinese: 蜡烛只有半英寸长时，烛光忽闪忽闪地熄灭了，于是房间一片漆黑。

detailed_translations.english: a stick of  wax  with a string through the middle, which you burn to give light

name: clerk
trans: A clerk is a person who works in an office or a store and is responsible for keeping records or serving customers.

sentences.english: a clerk in a commercial firm
sentences.chinese: 一家商行的文员

detailed_translations.chinese: 职员，办事员；店员；书记；记账员；<古>牧师，教士
detailed_translations.english: someone who keeps records or accounts in an office

detailed_translations.chinese: 当销售员，当店员；当职员
detailed_translations.english: to work as a clerk

name: cloud
trans: A cloud is a visible mass of water droplets or ice crystals suspended in the atmosphere.

sentences.english: Dark clouds floated across the moon.
sentences.chinese: 乌云飘过月亮。

sentences.english: A cloud of steam rose into the air.
sentences.chinese: 一团水蒸气升到空中。

sentences.english: Fears of renewed terrorist attacks cast a cloud over the event (= spoilt the happy situation ) .
sentences.chinese: 对恐怖分子再次发动袭击的担心给这次活动蒙上了一层阴影。

detailed_translations.english: a white or grey mass in the sky that forms from very small drops of water

name: concert
trans: A concert is a musical performance in front of an audience.

sentences.english: a rock concert
sentences.chinese: 摇滚音乐会

sentences.english: a concert of French choral music
sentences.chinese: 法国合唱音乐会

sentences.english: We were going to a concert in Bath Abbey.
sentences.chinese: 我们要去听一场在巴斯修道院内举行的音乐会。

sentences.english: She still does about 100 concerts every year.
sentences.chinese: 她每年仍然举行100场左右的演唱会。

detailed_translations.english: a performance given by musicians or singers

detailed_translations.chinese: 音乐会用的；在音乐会上演出的

name: counter
trans: A counter is a flat surface used for conducting business or for preparing food.

sentences.english: He wondered if the girl behind the counter recognised him.
sentences.chinese: 他在想柜台后面的那个女孩是否认出了他。

sentences.english: Set the video counter to zero before you press play.
sentences.chinese: 在按播放键之前，把录像机上的计数器调到零。

detailed_translations.english: the place where you pay or are served in a shop, bank, restaurant etc

name: flower
trans: A flower is the reproductive structure of a plant, usually colorful and fragrant.

sentences.english: a lovely rose bush with delicate pink flowers
sentences.chinese: 一簇开着娇嫩的粉红色花朵的美丽蔷薇

sentences.english: fields full of beautiful wild flowers
sentences.chinese: 开满美丽野花的田野

sentences.english: It was May, and the apple trees were all in flower.
sentences.chinese: 那是个5月，苹果树开满了花。

detailed_translations.english: a coloured or white part that a plant or tree produces before fruit or seeds

name: grandfather
trans: A grandfather is the father of a person's parent.

sentences.english: His grandfather was a professor.
sentences.chinese: 他爷爷曾是位教授。

detailed_translations.english: the father of your father or mother

name: harm
trans: Harm is physical or emotional damage that is caused to someone or something.

sentences.english: The scandal did his career a lot of harm.
sentences.chinese: 丑闻对他的职业生涯造成很大损害。

sentences.english: Our children deserve protection from harm.
sentences.chinese: 我们的儿童理应得到保护免受伤害。

sentences.english: chemicals that harm the environment
sentences.chinese: 损害环境的化学品

detailed_translations.english: damage, injury, or trouble caused by someone’s actions or by an event
to have a bad effect on something

name: knee
trans: A knee is the joint that connects the upper and lower parts of the leg.

sentences.english: Lucy had a bandage round her knee.
sentences.chinese: 露西的膝盖上缠着绷带。

sentences.english: a knee injury
sentences.chinese: 膝伤

detailed_translations.english: the joint that bends in the middle of your leg
to hit someone with your knee

name: lawyer
trans: A lawyer is a person who practices law, as an advocate, barrister, attorney, counselor, solicitor, notary, or civil law notary.

sentences.english: Prosecution and defence lawyers are expected to deliver closing arguments next week.
sentences.chinese: 原告律师和被告律师下周将要作终结辩论。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to advise people about laws, write formal agreements, or represent people in court

name: leather
trans: Leather is a material made from the skin of an animal, usually a cow, used to make shoes, belts, and other products.

sentences.english: The inside of the bag was lined with soft leather.
sentences.chinese: 这包的里面衬了软皮。

sentences.english: elegant leather boots
sentences.chinese: 精美的皮靴

detailed_translations.english: animal skin that has been treated to preserve it, and is used for making shoes, bags etc

name: load
trans: Load is the weight or burden carried by a person, animal, or vehicle.

sentences.english: Have you finished loading up?
sentences.chinese: 你装完货了吗？

sentences.english: It took an hour to load the van.
sentences.chinese: 给小型货车装货花了一小时。

sentences.english: Will you help me load the dishwasher?
sentences.chinese: 你帮我把碗碟放进洗碗机好吗？

sentences.english: The plane was carrying afull loadof fuel.
sentences.chinese: 飞机载满燃料。

detailed_translations.english: to put a large quantity of something into a vehicle or container
a large quantity of something that is carried by a vehicle, person etc

name: mirror
trans: A mirror is a reflective surface that shows a person's reflection.

sentences.english: He spends hours in front of the mirror !
sentences.chinese: 他老是照镜子！

sentences.english: When I looked in the mirror I couldn’t believe it. I looked fantastic!
sentences.chinese: 我看着镜子简直不敢相信，我看上去棒极了！

sentences.english: Henry’s sad smile mirrored that of his son.
sentences.chinese: 亨利脸上那苦涩的笑容跟他儿子一模一样。

sentences.english: The economic recovery in Britain was mirrored in the US.
sentences.chinese: 美国出现了和英国相似的经济复苏。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of special glass that you can look at and see yourself in
if one thing mirrors another, it is very similar to it and may seem to copy or represent it

name: neck
trans: The neck is the part of the body that connects the head to the shoulders.

sentences.english: Mike rubbed the back of his neck.
sentences.chinese: 迈克揉了揉后颈。

sentences.english: You have a lot of tension in your neck muscles.
sentences.chinese: 你的颈部肌肉很紧张。

sentences.english: He patted his horse’s neck.
sentences.chinese: 他拍了拍马脖子。

sentences.english: She had a mass of golden hair, which she wore in a coil at the nape  of her neck.
sentences.chinese: 她有一头金发，盘在脖子后面。

sentences.english: The dog picked up the puppy and carried it by the scruff of the neck into the house.
sentences.chinese: 那条狗叼住小狗的后颈，把它叼进了屋子。

detailed_translations.english: the part of your body that joins your head to your shoulders, or the same part of an animal or bird

name: pension
trans: A pension is a regular payment made to a person who has retired from work.

sentences.english: At what age can you start drawing your pension ?
sentences.chinese: 从多少岁可以开始领取养老金？

sentences.english: If you are self-employed, you should think about taking out a private pension .
sentences.chinese: 如果你是自由职业者，应该考虑办理私人养老金事宜。

sentences.english: Many people find it hard to live on a basic state pension .
sentences.chinese: 许多人发现仅凭国家基本养老金不能养活自己。

sentences.english: She pays a quarter of her salary into a pension plan.
sentences.chinese: 她将每月工资的四分之一用于养老金计划。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money paid regularly by the government or company to someone who does not work any more, for example because they have reached the age when people stop working or because they are ill
to grant a pension to

name: plate
trans: A plate is a flat dish used for serving or eating food.

sentences.english: The plates were piled high with rice.
sentences.chinese: 盘子里都堆满了米饭。

sentences.english: a beautiful necklace, plated with 22-carat gold
sentences.chinese: 一条漂亮的22开镀金项链

detailed_translations.english: flat and usually round dish that you eat from or serve food on
to be covered with a thin covering of gold or silver

name: purple
trans: Purple is a color that is a mixture of blue and red.

sentences.english: A purple may be made by dyeing a blue over a red.
sentences.chinese: 红色染上蓝色便可成为紫色。

sentences.english: She had a purple dress on with a silver-white necklace.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着一条紫色的连衣裙配着一条银白色的项链。

detailed_translations.english: a dark colour that is a mixture of red and blue
having a dark colour that is a mixture of red and blue

name: ruin
trans: Ruin is the state of being destroyed or in disrepair.

sentences.english: an interesting old ruin
sentences.chinese: 一处有意思的古老废墟

sentences.english: the ruins of a bombed-out office block
sentences.chinese: 被炸毁的办公楼的废墟

sentences.english: Jefferson was ruined by the lawsuit.
sentences.chinese: 杰弗逊因为那场官司倾家荡产。

sentences.english: This illness has ruined my life.
sentences.chinese: 这个病毁掉了我的生活。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a building that is left after the rest has been destroyed
to make someone lose all their money

name: ship
trans: A ship is a large vessel used for transporting goods or people across water.

sentences.english: We'll ship your order to the address we print on your cheques.
sentences.chinese: 我们将把你预订的货物送到我们印在你单据上的地址。

detailed_translations.english: to send goods somewhere by ship, plane, truck etc
a large boat used for carrying people or goods across the sea

name: skirt
trans: A skirt is a garment worn by women that hangs from the waist and covers the legs.

sentences.english: She wore a white blouse and a plain black skirt.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着白衬衣和纯黑的裙子。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of outer clothing worn by women and girls, which hangs down from the waist like the bottom part of a dress
to avoid talking about an important subject, especially because it is difficult or embarrassing – used to show disapproval

name: slice
trans: A slice is a thin, flat piece of something that has been cut.

sentences.english: pizza slices
sentences.chinese: 比萨块

sentences.english: Cut the tomatoes into slices .
sentences.chinese: 把番茄切成片。

detailed_translations.english: a thin flat piece of food cut from a larger piece
to hit a ball, for example in tennis or golf, so that it spins sideways instead of moving straight forward

name: snow
trans: Snow is a type of precipitation that falls from the sky in cold weather and covers the ground in white.

sentences.english: Snow was falling heavily as we entered the village.
sentences.chinese: 我们进村的时候雪下得正大。

sentences.english: I could see footprints in the snow.
sentences.chinese: 我看到雪地里有脚印。

sentences.english: The town was buried under three feet of snow.
sentences.chinese: 小镇被三英尺厚的积雪覆盖着。

detailed_translations.english: soft white pieces of frozen water that fall from the sky in cold weather and cover the ground
if it snows, snow falls from the sky

name: specialist
trans: A specialist is a person who has expertise in a particular field or subject.

sentences.english: a heart specialist
sentences.chinese: 心脏专科医生

detailed_translations.english: someone who knows a lot about a particular subject, or is very skilled at it

name: stroke
trans: A stroke is a medical condition that occurs when the blood supply to the brain is interrupted.

sentences.english: She died following a massive stroke.
sentences.chinese: 她重度中风后去世了。

sentences.english: a stroke patient
sentences.chinese: 中风患者

sentences.english: His punishment was six strokes of the cane.
sentences.chinese: 给他的惩罚是挨六教鞭。

sentences.english: At the first stroke it will be 9 o'clock exactly.
sentences.chinese: 等到钟敲第一下时就是9点整。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden serious illness when a blood vessel in the brain bursts or is blocked, which can cause death or the loss of the ability to move or to speak clearly

name: switch
trans: A switch is a device used to turn something on or off or to change its direction or mode of operation.

sentences.english: The terrorists will switch tactics .
sentences.chinese: 恐怖分子会改变战术。

detailed_translations.english: to change from doing or using one thing to doing or using another

name: trash
trans: Trash is waste material that is no longer useful and is thrown away.

sentences.english: Will someone take out the trash (= take it outside the house ) ?
sentences.chinese: 谁把垃圾拿出去好吗？

sentences.english: Just put it in the trash .
sentences.chinese: 就把它扔到垃圾桶里吧。

detailed_translations.english: things that you throw away, such as empty bottles, used papers, food that has gone bad etc

name: tune
trans: A tune is a melody or musical composition.

sentences.english: That’s a nice tune.
sentences.chinese: 那曲调很美。

sentences.english: She sang some old classics and a few new tunes.
sentences.chinese: 她唱了几首经典老歌和一些新曲。

sentences.english: Someone’s coming tomorrow to tune the piano.
sentences.chinese: 明天有人来给钢琴调音。

detailed_translations.english: a series of musical notes that are played or sung and are nice to listen to
to make a musical instrument play at the right pitch

name: zone
trans: A zone is an area or region that has specific characteristics or is designated for a particular purpose.

sentences.english: San Francisco and Tokyo are both located in earthquake zones.
sentences.chinese: 旧金山和东京都位于地震带。

sentences.english: The government has set up a special economic zone to promote private enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 政府设立了一个经济特区来推动私营企业的发展。

detailed_translations.english: a large area that is different from other areas around it in some way

name: anger
trans: Anger is a strong feeling of displeasure or hostility.

sentences.english: There is growing anger among the people against the government.
sentences.chinese: 民众对政府越来越不满。

sentences.english: What angered me most was his total lack of remorse.
sentences.chinese: 最让我生气的是他居然毫无悔意。

detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of wanting to hurt or criticize someone because they have done something bad to you or been unkind to you
to make someone angry

name: award
trans: An award is a prize or recognition given to a person or group for their achievements.

sentences.english: Moodie has been awarded a golf scholarship at the University of Hawaii.
sentences.chinese: 穆迪获授夏威夷大学高尔夫奖学金。

sentences.english: The movie has won a number of awards.
sentences.chinese: 该片获得了多个奖项。

detailed_translations.english: to officially give someone something such as a prize or money to reward them for something they have done
something such as a prize or money given to someone to reward them for something they have done

name: bid
trans: A bid is an offer or proposal to buy or do something.

sentences.english: the person who places the highest bid
sentences.chinese: 出价最高的人

sentences.english: We’ve made a bid of nearly £400 million for the company.
sentences.chinese: 我们出价近四亿英镑收购那家公司。

sentences.english: A takeover bid for the airline was launched today.
sentences.chinese: 今天有人出价收购该航空公司。

sentences.english: She bid £100 for a Victorian chair.
sentences.chinese: 她出价100英镑买一把维多利亚时代的椅子。

sentences.english: The two men ended up bidding against each other at the auction.
sentences.chinese: 结果那两个人在拍卖会上较起劲来。

detailed_translations.english: an offer to pay a particular price for something, especially at an  auction
to offer to pay a particular price for goods, especially in an auction

name: bitter
trans: Bitter is a taste that is sharp, harsh, and unpleasant.

sentences.english: His photo stirred up bitter memories.
sentences.chinese: 他的照片勾起了痛苦的回忆。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel very unhappy and upset

name: boot
trans: A boot is a type of footwear that covers the foot and ankle and sometimes extends up the leg.

sentences.english: hiking boots
sentences.chinese: 远足靴

sentences.english: a pair of boots
sentences.chinese: 一双靴子

detailed_translations.english: a type of shoe that covers your whole foot and the lower part of your leg

name: bug
trans: A bug is an insect or a small creature that can cause harm or annoyance.

sentences.english: There’s a nasty bug going round (=  that a lot of people have caught  ) .
sentences.chinese: 现在流行着一种很烦人的传染病。

sentences.english: a 24-hour flu bug
sentences.chinese: 一天即愈的流感

detailed_translations.chinese: 虫子；小病；故障，缺陷；窃听器
detailed_translations.english: an illness that people catch very easily from each other but is not very serious

detailed_translations.chinese: 烦扰， 纠缠； 在…装窃听器
detailed_translations.english: to put a  bug (=  small piece of electronic equipment  )  somewhere secretly in order to listen to conversations

name: camp
trans: A camp is a temporary shelter or dwelling used for camping or outdoor activities.

sentences.english: Let’s go back to camp – it’s getting dark.
sentences.chinese: 我们回营地吧，天快黑了。

sentences.english: a camp near Lake Ellen Wilson
sentences.chinese: 埃伦•威尔逊湖边的营地

sentences.english: The soldiers broke camp (= took down their tents etc ) and left before dawn.
sentences.chinese: 士兵们在黎明前拔营出发了。

sentences.english: We set up camp (= made the camping place ready ) at nearby Icicle Lake.
sentences.chinese: 我们在附近的冰柱湖边建了营地。

sentences.english: The expedition’s base camp (= main camp ) was 6,000 feet below the summit.
sentences.chinese: 探险队的大本营在山峰下面6,000英尺处。

detailed_translations.english: a place where people stay in tents, shelters etc for a short time, usually in the mountains, a forest etc
to set up a tent or shelter and stay there for a short time

name: candy
trans: Candy is a sweet treat made from sugar or chocolate.

sentences.english: ...a piece of candy.
sentences.chinese: …一块糖果。

detailed_translations.chinese: 用糖煮；使结晶为砂糖；美化
糖果（等于sweets）；冰糖（等于sugar candy，rock candy）；毒品
detailed_translations.english: Candy is sweet foods such as chocolate or toffees

detailed_translations.chinese: 新潮的（服饰）；甜言蜜语的

name: carpet
trans: A carpet is a type of flooring made of fabric or woven material.

sentences.english: The building has been carpeted throughout.
sentences.chinese: 大楼里上上下下都铺了地毯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 在…上铺地毯，把地毯铺在…上；斥责
detailed_translations.english: to cover a floor with carpet
heavy woven material for covering floors or stairs, or a piece of this material

name: cat
trans: A cat is a small, furry animal that is often kept as a pet.

sentences.english: The police played an elaborate game of cat and mouse to trap him.
sentences.chinese: 警方跟他玩了一场精心布局的猫捉老鼠游戏，诱他落网。

detailed_translations.english: a small animal with four legs that people often keep as a pet

name: champion
trans: A champion is a person or team that has won a competition or tournament.

sentences.english: the world heavyweight boxing champion
sentences.chinese: 世界重量级拳击冠军

sentences.english: the Olympic champion
sentences.chinese: 奥运会冠军

sentences.english: He passionately championed the poor.
sentences.chinese: 他曾热情地捍卫穷人。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that has won a competition, especially in sport
If you champion a person, a cause, or a principle, you support or defend them

name: channel
trans: A channel is a way for something to flow, such as a river or a TV station.

sentences.english: the news on Channel 4
sentences.chinese: 第四频道播出的新闻

sentences.english: The kids are watching cartoons on the Disney Channel.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在看迪士尼频道的卡通片。

sentences.english: What channel is ‘ER’ on?
sentences.chinese: 《仁心仁术》在哪个频道播放？

sentences.english: He changed channels to watch the basketball game.
sentences.chinese: 他转换频道看篮球比赛。

detailed_translations.english: a television station and all the programmes that it broadcasts

detailed_translations.chinese: 把〔钱、精力等〕导向〔特定目的〕；引导；把…用于
detailed_translations.english: to control and direct something such as money or energy towards a particular purpose

name: clock
trans: A clock is a device that tells time, usually with a face and hands.

sentences.english: I heard the clock strike six (= make six loud sounds ) .
sentences.chinese: 我听到钟敲了六下。

sentences.english: The station clock was ten minutes slow (= showed a time ten minutes earlier than the real time ) .
sentences.chinese: 车站的钟慢了十分钟。

detailed_translations.english: an instrument that shows what time it is, in a room or outside on a building

name: comfort
