name: tell
trans: To tell is to communicate information or a story to someone.

sentences.english: I’ll tell you all about it when I get back.
sentences.chinese: 我回来再告诉你这一切。

sentences.english: Sheppard was telling the truth .
sentences.chinese: 谢泼德说的是实话。

detailed_translations.english: if someone tells you something, they communicate information, a story, their feelings etc to you

detailed_translations.chinese: (Tell)人名；(英、德、瑞典)特尔；(罗、意)泰尔；(阿拉伯)塔勒

name: cost
trans: Cost refers to the amount of money that is required to purchase or produce something.

sentences.english: I offered to pay the cost of the taxi.
sentences.chinese: 我提出支付出租车费。

sentences.english: Insurance to cover the cost of a funeral is possible.
sentences.chinese: 可以用保险支付葬礼费用。

sentences.english: This doesn’t include the cost of repairing the damage.
sentences.chinese: 这不包括修理破损的费用。

sentences.english: the terrible cost of the war in death and suffering
sentences.chinese: 这场战争造成的死亡与苦难的惨重代价

sentences.english: low cost housing
sentences.chinese: 低成本住宅

sentences.english: the high cost of production
sentences.chinese: 很高的生产成本

sentences.english: A cassette/radio is included at no extra cost .
sentences.chinese: 附送一台卡式收录机。

sentences.english: The funds will just cover the museum’s running costs .
sentences.chinese: 这些资金只够支付博物馆的运转费用。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of money that you have to pay in order to buy, do, or produce something

name: drive
trans: To drive is to operate a vehicle or to motivate or push oneself or others to achieve a goal.

sentences.english: Can you drive?
sentences.chinese: 你会开车吗？

sentences.english: We watched Dad drive the posts into the ground.
sentences.chinese: 我们看着爸爸把木桩打入地里。

sentences.english: With a few loud whistles, they drove the donkeys out of the enclosure.
sentences.chinese: 随着几声响亮的哨声，他们把驴子赶出了围栏。

detailed_translations.english: to make a car, truck, bus etc move along

name: green
trans: Green refers to the color of grass or leaves, or something that is environmentally friendly.

sentences.english: beautiful green eyes
sentences.chinese: 漂亮的碧眼

sentences.english: Raw coffee beans are green in colour.
sentences.chinese: 生咖啡豆是绿色的。

sentences.english: a room decorated in pale blues and greens
sentences.chinese: 用浅蓝色和浅绿色装修的房间

detailed_translations.english: having the colour of grass or leaves
the colour of grass and leaves

name: support
trans: To support is to help or assist someone or something, often by providing resources or encouragement.

sentences.english: The bill was supported by a large majority in the Senate.
sentences.chinese: 这项法案得到参议院绝大多数人的支持。

sentences.english: We strongly support the peace process.
sentences.chinese: 我们大力拥护和平进程。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you agree with an idea, group, or person, and usually to help them because you want them to succeed

detailed_translations.chinese: 支持， 支撑物， 支持者
detailed_translations.english: something that presses on something else to hold it up or in position

name: glad
trans: Glad refers to a feeling of happiness or satisfaction.

sentences.english: We’re so glad you came.
sentences.chinese: 你来了我们真高兴。

sentences.english: ‘I’ve decided to accept the job.’ ‘I’m glad.’
sentences.chinese: “我决定接受这份工作。”“我很高兴。”

sentences.english: I’d be glad if you’d let me know when the funeral is.
sentences.chinese: 如果你能告诉我葬礼的时间，我将非常感激。

detailed_translations.english: pleased and happy about something

name: remove
trans: To remove is to take something away or to eliminate or get rid of something.

sentences.english: a cleaner that will remove wine stains
sentences.chinese: 可去除葡萄酒酒渍的清洁剂

sentences.english: The college removed rules that prevented women from enrolling.
sentences.chinese: 这所大学取消了禁止女性入学的规定。

detailed_translations.english: to get rid of something so that it does not exist any longer

name: return
trans: To return is to go back to a previous place or condition, or to give something back to its original owner.

sentences.english: It was forty five minutes before she returned.
sentences.chinese: 过了45分钟她才回来。

sentences.english: Alison decided to return home.
sentences.chinese: 艾利森决定回家。

sentences.english: He left his country, never to return.
sentences.chinese: 他离开了祖国，一去不复返。

detailed_translations.english: to go or come back to a place where you were before
the act of returning from somewhere, or your arrival back in a place
used or paid for a journey from one place to another and back again

name: run
trans: To run is to move quickly on foot.

sentences.english: For a while, she ran a restaurant in Boston.
sentences.chinese: 有一段时间她在波士顿开餐馆。

sentences.english: Many people don’t care who runs the country.
sentences.chinese: 很多人不在乎由谁统治国家。

sentences.english: Courses are currently being run in London and Edinburgh.
sentences.chinese: 目前伦敦和爱丁堡两地都开设了这些课程。

sentences.english: Many people belong to a pension scheme run by their employers.
sentences.chinese: 许多人参加了由雇主管理的养老金计划。

sentences.english: a state-run (= controlled by the government ) television station
sentences.chinese: 国营电视台

detailed_translations.english: to organize or be in charge of an activity, business, organization, or country

detailed_translations.chinese: 奔跑；赛跑；趋向；奔跑的路程
detailed_translations.english: to be very busy and continuously rushing about

name: complex
trans: Complex means something that is made up of many interconnected parts or elements.

sentences.english: a complex system of highways
sentences.chinese: 复杂的公路网

sentences.english: Photosynthesis is a highly complex process.
sentences.chinese: 光合作用是一个非常复杂的过程。

sentences.english: Peter seemed to have an instant understanding of the most complex issues.
sentences.chinese: 再复杂的问题彼得似乎也是一看就明白。

sentences.english: It was a very complex relationship between two complex people.
sentences.chinese: 这是两个复杂的人之间非常复杂的关系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由许多部分组成的，复合的；复杂的，难懂的
detailed_translations.english: consisting of many different parts and often difficult to understand

detailed_translations.chinese: 综合体， 集合体； 情结， 夸大的情绪反应
detailed_translations.english: a group of buildings, or a large building with many parts, used for a particular purpose

name: due
trans: Due means something that is expected to happen or owed to someone or something.

sentences.english: The team are due to fly to Italy next month.
sentences.chinese: 该球队预定下个月飞往意大利。

sentences.english: Any money due you will be sent by cheque through the post.
sentences.chinese: 应该支付给你的款项将会以支票邮寄给你。

detailed_translations.english: expected to happen or arrive at a particular time

name: effective
trans: Effective means something that is successful in producing the desired result.

sentences.english: The cheaper drugs are just as effective in treating arthritis.
sentences.chinese: 较便宜的药品对治疗关节炎同样有效。

sentences.english: the painting’s highly effective use of colour
sentences.chinese: 绘画中得心应手的色彩运用

sentences.english: Training is often much less effective than expected.
sentences.chinese: 训练的效果往往远低于预期。

sentences.english: the most effective ways of reducing inner city congestion
sentences.chinese: 减少旧城区交通拥挤最有效的办法

detailed_translations.english: successful, and working in the way that was intended

name: middle
trans: Middle refers to the central point or position between two things.

sentences.english: We rowed out towards the middle of the lake.
sentences.chinese: 我们朝湖中央划去。

sentences.english: They spent the middle part of their vacation in Florida.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：假期的中间一段他们是在佛罗里达州度过的。

detailed_translations.english: the part that is nearest the centre of something, and furthest from the sides, edges, top, bottom etc
half of the way through an event or period of time

name: regular
trans: Regular means something that happens or occurs frequently or at the same intervals.

sentences.english: The company holds regular meetings with employees.
sentences.chinese: 公司定期召集雇员开会。

sentences.english: His breathing was slow and regular.
sentences.chinese: 他的呼吸缓慢而均匀。

sentences.english: Trains will run at regular intervals from 11 am to 4 pm.
sentences.chinese: 火车从上午11点到下午4点每隔一定时间开行。

sentences.english: We hear from him on a regular basis .
sentences.chinese: 我们定期收到他的来信。

sentences.english: He phones us every Sunday at six, regular as clockwork (= always at the same time ) .
sentences.chinese: 他每逢星期天6点钟打电话给我们，非常准时。

sentences.english: a regular job
sentences.chinese: 固定的工作

detailed_translations.english: happening every hour, every week, every month etc, usually with the same amount of time in between

name: reserve
trans: Reserve means to set something aside or keep something for future use or purpose.

sentences.english: Do you have to reserve tickets in advance?
sentences.chinese: 你必须预先订票吗？

detailed_translations.english: to arrange for a place in a hotel, restaurant, plane etc to be kept for you to use at a particular time in the future

detailed_translations.chinese: 储备； 保留； 拘谨， 矜持； 替补队员， 后备部队； 自然保护区
detailed_translations.english: a supply of something kept to be used if it is needed

name: independent
trans: Independent means something that is free from the control or influence of others.

sentences.english: There are plans to split the corporation into a number of smaller independent companies.
sentences.chinese: 有计划要把这家大企业分割成一些独立的小公司。

sentences.english: an independent charity
sentences.chinese: 独立的慈善机构

sentences.english: small independent bookshops
sentences.chinese: 私营小书店

sentences.english: schools in the independent sector
sentences.chinese: 私立学校

detailed_translations.english: an independent organization is not owned or controlled by, or does not receive money from, another organization or the government

name: leave
trans: To leave is to go away from a place or to stop doing something.

sentences.english: My baby gets upset when I leave the room.
sentences.chinese: 我一离开房间宝宝就会不安。

sentences.english: Before leaving the train, make sure you have all your belongings with you.
sentences.chinese: 下火车前一定要带好随身物品。

sentences.english: Leave the motorway at Junction 7.
sentences.chinese: 请在七号交叉路口驶离高速公路。

sentences.english: My youngest boy has not left my side (= has stayed near me ) since his daddy was killed.
sentences.chinese: 我最小的儿子自从他爸爸死后就没有离开过我的身边。

detailed_translations.english: to go away from a place or a person
to go away from a place or a person

name: original
trans: Original means something that is the first or earliest form of something.

sentences.english: The land was returned to its original owner.
sentences.chinese: 这块土地归还给了原主。

sentences.english: The kitchen still has many original features (= parts that were there when the house was first built ).
sentences.chinese: 这间厨房仍保留着当初的许多特点。

sentences.english: the original meaning of the word
sentences.chinese: 这个单词的原意

sentences.english: The original plan was to fly out to New York.
sentences.chinese: 原先的计划是飞往纽约。

detailed_translations.english: existing or happening first, before other people or things

name: reach
trans: To reach is to arrive at a particular place or to make contact with something.

sentences.english: We reached London late at night.
sentences.chinese: 我们深夜到达伦敦。

sentences.english: She reached into her bag and produced a business card.
sentences.chinese: 她伸手从包里取出一张名片。

sentences.english: Chelsea could reach the final of the European Cup.
sentences.chinese: 切尔西队会进入欧洲杯决赛。

detailed_translations.english: to arrive at a place

name: rest
trans: Rest means to relax or take a break from activity.

sentences.english: If you’re tired, we’ll stop and rest for a while.
sentences.chinese: 如果你累了，我们就停下来歇一会儿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使休息，使轻松；把…寄托于
detailed_translations.english: to stop working or doing an activity for a time and sit down or lie down to relax

detailed_translations.chinese: 休息，静止；休息时间；剩余部分；支架
detailed_translations.english: a period of time when you are not doing anything tiring and you can relax or sleep

name: serve
trans: To serve is to provide a service or perform a duty for someone or something.

sentences.english: There was only one girl serving customers .
sentences.chinese: 只有一个女孩在接待顾客。

detailed_translations.chinese: 招待，供应；为…服务；对…有用；可作…用
detailed_translations.english: to help the customers in a shop, especially by bringing them the things that they want
the action in a game such as tennis or  volleyball  when you throw the ball in the air and hit it over the net

name: watch
trans: To watch is to observe or pay attention to something.

sentences.english: Do you mind if I watch?
sentences.chinese: 你介意我看着吗？

sentences.english: We sat and watched the sunset.
sentences.chinese: 我们坐下来看日落。

sentences.english: Ruth could not bear to watch her parents arguing.
sentences.chinese: 露丝看不得父母争吵。

sentences.english: Most parents don’t know what their kids are watching on TV.
sentences.chinese: 大多数父母不知道自己的孩子都在看什么电视节目。

detailed_translations.english: to look at someone or something for a period of time, paying attention to what is happening
a small clock that you wear on your wrist or keep in your pocket

name: beautiful
trans: Beautiful means something that is pleasing to the senses or aesthetically pleasing.

sentences.english: She was even more beautiful than I had remembered.
sentences.chinese: 她比我记忆中更美。

sentences.english: a beautiful bunch of flowers
sentences.chinese: 一束美丽的花

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is beautiful is extremely attractive to look at

name: charge
trans: To charge means to demand payment or to entrust someone with a responsibility.

sentences.english: Leave the battery on charge all night.
sentences.chinese: 让电池充一晚上的电

sentences.english: Please charge your glasses and drink a toast to the bride and groom!
sentences.chinese: 请各位斟满酒杯向新娘、新郎敬酒！

detailed_translations.english: electricity that is put into a piece of electrical equipment such as a battery
to fill a glass

name: active
trans: Active means something that is involved in ongoing action or movement.

sentences.english: games for active youngsters
sentences.chinese: 活跃好动的年轻人玩的游戏

sentences.english: She’s over 80, but is still very active.
sentences.chinese: 她80多岁了，但仍旧很活跃。

sentences.english: He became politically active at college.
sentences.chinese: 他上大学时开始积极参与政治活动。

detailed_translations.english: always busy doing things, especially physical or mental activities

name: break
trans: To break is to separate something into pieces or to stop working properly.

sentences.english: I had to break a window to get into the house.
sentences.chinese: 我只得打破一扇窗户进屋。

detailed_translations.english: if you break something, you make it separate into two or more pieces, for example by hitting it, dropping it, or bending it

name: negative
trans: Negative means something that is unfavorable or not constructive.

sentences.english: students with a negative attitude to school
sentences.chinese: 对上学抱消极态度的学生

sentences.english: They have a uniformly negative image of the police.
sentences.chinese: 他们都对警察印象不好。

sentences.english: Jean rarely sounded so negative about her mother.
sentences.chinese: 琼很少这么说她母亲不好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 否定的，消极的；负的，阴性的
detailed_translations.english: considering only the bad qualities of a situation, person etc and not the good ones

detailed_translations.chinese: 负片， 底片； 负数
detailed_translations.english: an image on a photographic film that shows dark areas as light and light areas as dark, from which the final picture is printed

name: safe
trans: Safe means something that is free from danger or harm.

sentences.english: She doesn’t feel safe in the house on her own.
sentences.chinese: 她独自一人在家感到不安全。

sentences.english: Make sure you keep these documents safe .
sentences.chinese: 你一定要妥善保管这些文件。

detailed_translations.english: not in danger of being harmed, lost, or stolen
a strong metal box or cupboard with special locks where you keep money and valuable things

name: stay
trans: To stay is to remain in a particular place or to continue in a particular state or condition.

sentences.english: They stayed all afternoon chatting.
sentences.chinese: 他们待了整个下午聊天。

sentences.english: She stayed late to finish the report.
sentences.chinese: 为了完成报告，她工作到很晚。

detailed_translations.english: to remain in a place rather than leave
a limited time of living in a place

name: visit
trans: To visit is to go to a place to see someone or something.

sentences.english: Eric went to Seattle to visit his cousins.
sentences.chinese: 埃里克到西雅图去看望他的表兄弟。

detailed_translations.english: to go and spend time in a place or with someone, especially for pleasure or interest

name: visual
trans: Visual means something that is related to seeing or visual perception.

sentences.english: Artists translate their ideas into visual images.
sentences.chinese: 画家把自己的思想转换成视觉画面。

detailed_translations.english: relating to seeing

name: affect
trans: To affect means to have an influence on or to produce a change in something.

sentences.english: the areas affected by the hurricane
sentences.chinese: 受飓风影响的地区

sentences.english: a disease that affects the central nervous system
sentences.chinese: 影响中枢神经系统的疾病

sentences.english: decisions which affect our lives
sentences.chinese: 影响我们生活的决定

sentences.english: Trading has been adversely affected by the downturn in consumer spending.
sentences.chinese: 贸易受到消费支出回落的不利影响。

sentences.english: We were all deeply affected by her death.
sentences.chinese: 我们都为她的去世深感悲痛。

detailed_translations.english: to do something that produces an effect or change in something or in someone’s situation

name: cover
trans: To cover is to place something over or around something else to conceal or protect it.

sentences.english: I’d just returned from covering the Cambodian war.
sentences.chinese: 我刚报道完柬埔寨战争回来。

detailed_translations.english: to report the details of an event for a newspaper or a television or radio programme

name: report
trans: A report is a written or spoken description of something, often giving information about an event or situation.

sentences.english: This is Gavin Williams, reporting from the United Nations in New York.
sentences.chinese: 我是加文·威廉斯，在纽约联合国总部为您报道。

sentences.english: We aim to report the news as fairly as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我们力求公正地报道这一新闻。

sentences.english: The incident was widely reported in the national press.
sentences.chinese: 这一事件在全国的媒体上被广泛报道。

detailed_translations.english: to give people information about recent events, especially in newspapers and on television and radio

name: rise
trans: To rise is to move upward from a lower position or to increase in amount or number.

sentences.english: The police seem unable to cope with the rising tide of (= large increase in ) car crime.
sentences.chinese: 面对日益增多的汽车罪案，警方似乎无能为力。

detailed_translations.english: to increase in number, amount, or value
an increase in number, amount, or value

name: walk
trans: To walk is to move forward by putting one foot in front of the other.

sentences.english: It’s a long walk. Maybe we should get the bus.
sentences.chinese: 走着去很远，或许我们应该乘公共汽车。

sentences.english: Rosanna and Forbes walked in silence.
sentences.chinese: 罗莎娜与福布斯默默地走着。

sentences.english: We walked into the foyer.
sentences.chinese: 我们走进前厅。

sentences.english: I walked a few steps toward the fence.
sentences.chinese: 我向栅栏走了几步。

detailed_translations.english: a journey that you make by walking, especially for exercise or enjoyment
When you walk, you move forward by putting one foot in front of the other in a regular way

name: white
trans: White is the color of snow, milk, or chalk, and is the opposite of black.

sentences.english: young white males
sentences.chinese: 年轻的白种男性

detailed_translations.english: belonging to the race of people with pale skin

name: beyond
trans: Beyond means further away in distance or time, or in a more advanced state or stage.

sentences.english: They crossed the mountains and headed for the valleys beyond.
sentences.chinese: 他们翻过山，向更远处的山谷进发。

sentences.english: Beyond the river, cattle were grazing.
sentences.chinese: 河的那边，牛在吃草。

sentences.english: She drove through Westport, and stopped a few miles beyond at a wayside inn.
sentences.chinese: 她驱车穿过西港，在几英里外的一个路边旅馆停了下来。

detailed_translations.english: on or to the further side of something

name: junior
trans: Junior is used to describe someone who is younger or less experienced than someone else in the same profession or organization.

sentences.english: She now lives with actor Denis Lawson, 10 years her junior.
sentences.chinese: 她现在和比她小10岁的演员丹尼斯·劳森同居。

detailed_translations.english: If you are someone's junior, you are younger than they are

name: pick
trans: To pick is to choose something or someone from a group of options.

sentences.english: The Roman Swiss Army knife has a knife, spoon, fork, spike, spatula, and small pick.
sentences.chinese: 这种古罗马瑞士军刀包含了刀，勺，叉，长钉，抹刀和小鹤嘴锄。

detailed_translations.english: a  pickaxe

name: unique
trans: Unique means being the only one of its kind, unlike anything else.

sentences.english: Each person’s fingerprints are unique.
sentences.chinese: 每个人的指纹都是独一无二的。

detailed_translations.english: being the only one of its kind

name: anything
trans: Anything means any thing or object, no matter what it is.

sentences.english: You can buy anything you want.
sentences.chinese: 你想要什么都可以买。

sentences.english: He was prepared to do anything to make a bit of money.
sentences.chinese: 只要能赚一点钱，他什么都愿意做。

sentences.english: Anything would be better than staying at home!
sentences.chinese: 做什么都比待在家里好！

sentences.english: You can write about swimming, skiing, or anything else you enjoy doing.
sentences.chinese: 你可以写游泳、写滑雪或者其他任何你喜欢的活动。

detailed_translations.english: any thing, event, situation etc, when it is not important to say exactly which

name: classic
trans: Classic refers to something of lasting value or traditional style, often used to describe a piece of art or literature.

sentences.english: The Coca-Cola bottle is one of the classic designs of the last century.
sentences.chinese: 可口可乐瓶是上个世纪的经典设计之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: 最优秀的，典型的，标准的；传统式样的，典雅的
detailed_translations.english: having all the features that are typical or expected of a particular thing or situation

detailed_translations.chinese: 文学名著， 经典作品， 杰作； 优秀的典范； 古典文学， 古典语文研究
detailed_translations.english: a book, play, or film that is important and has been admired for a long time

name: final
trans: Final means being the last in a series, or the concluding part of something.

sentences.english: The final episode will be shown tonight.
sentences.chinese: 最后一集将于今晚播出。

sentences.english: students preparing for their final examinations
sentences.chinese: 正在准备期末考试的学生

sentences.english: Stone is filming the final instalment of his Vietnam trilogy.
sentences.chinese: 斯通正在拍摄越战三部曲的最后一部。

sentences.english: the final stages in their relationship
sentences.chinese: 他们之间关系的最后阶段

sentences.english: They scored in the final minutes of the game.
sentences.chinese: 他们在比赛的最后几分钟得分。

sentences.english: We can advise the client, but in the end it is he who has the final say.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以提出建议，但是最终的决定权还是在客户自己手里。

detailed_translations.english: last in a series of actions, events, parts of a story etc

name: lift
trans: To lift is to move something upward or to raise something to a higher position.

sentences.english: Sophie lifted the phone before the second ring.
sentences.chinese: 铃响了一下苏菲就接起了电话。

sentences.english: He lifted the lid on the pot of soup.
sentences.chinese: 他揭开汤锅的盖子。

sentences.english: The lumber was lifted by crane and dropped into the truck.
sentences.chinese: 木材由起重机搬运到卡车上。

sentences.english: They took the lift down to the bar.
sentences.chinese: 他们乘电梯去楼下的酒吧。

sentences.english: It’s on the 3rd floor. Let’s use the lift.
sentences.chinese: 在三楼，我们乘电梯上去吧。

detailed_translations.english: to move something or someone upwards into the air
a machine that you can ride in, that moves up and down between the floors in a tall building

name: mix
trans: To mix is to combine two or more substances together to form a new mixture.

sentences.english: Oil and water don’t mix.
sentences.chinese: 油和水不相融。

detailed_translations.english: if you mix two or more substances or if they mix, they combine to become a single substance, and they cannot be easily separated

name: private
trans: Private means belonging to or for the use of one particular person or group, not for public or general use.

sentences.english: Morris has a private jet.
sentences.chinese: 莫里斯拥有一架私人喷气式飞机。

sentences.english: He made some notes for his private use.
sentences.chinese: 他记了些笔记供自己所用。

sentences.english: They objected to any form of private property .
sentences.chinese: 他们反对任何形式的私有财产。

detailed_translations.english: for use by one person or group, not for everyone

name: stop
trans: To stop is to cease movement or action.

sentences.english: Stop throwing those stones!
sentences.chinese: 别再扔那些石头了！

detailed_translations.english: to block a hole or pipe so that water, smoke etc cannot go through it
if an activity comes to a stop, it stops happening

name: teach
trans: To teach is to impart knowledge or skills to someone through instruction or example.

sentences.english: She taught me fractions and counting.
sentences.chinese: 他教我分数和计算。

detailed_translations.english: to give lessons in a school, college, or university, or to help someone learn about something by giving them information

name: western
trans: Western refers to something related to the Western Hemisphere, or the customs and culture of the American West.

sentences.english: the western end of the bay
sentences.chinese: 海湾的西端

sentences.english: Western Australia
sentences.chinese: 西澳大利亚

detailed_translations.chinese: 西方的，西部的；有西方特征的
detailed_translations.english: in or from the west of a country or area

detailed_translations.chinese: 西方人；西部片，西部小说
detailed_translations.english: a film about life in the 19th century in the American West, especially the lives of cowboys

name: concern
trans: Concern means to be worried or anxious about something.

sentences.english: He was moved by her obvious concern.
sentences.chinese: 她明显的关心使他感动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 关切的事，有关的事；关心，挂念；关系，关联；公司，企业
detailed_translations.english: a feeling of wanting someone to be happy and healthy

detailed_translations.chinese: 涉及， 有关； 使关心， 使担心
detailed_translations.english: if a story, book, report etc concerns someone or something, it is about them

name: familiar
trans: Familiar means well-known or easily recognized, often because of being seen or experienced before.

sentences.english: a familiar tune
sentences.chinese: 熟悉的曲调

sentences.english: It was a relief to be back in familiar surroundings .
sentences.chinese: 回到熟悉的环境里让人松了一口气。

sentences.english: Beggars on the street are becoming a familiar sight .
sentences.chinese: 街上出现乞丐的情况逐渐变得屡见不鲜。

sentences.english: This kind of situation was all too familiar (= very familiar ) to John.
sentences.chinese: 这种情形对约翰来说太熟悉了。

sentences.english: Her face seems vaguely familiar , but I can’t quite place her.
sentences.chinese: 她看起来有点面熟，但我还是认不出她来。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is familiar is well-known to you and easy to recognize

name: fly
trans: To fly is to travel through the air by means of wings or an aircraft.

sentences.english: Ellen flew across the room and greeted her uncle with a kiss.
sentences.chinese: 埃伦从房间那头飞奔过来，给了她叔叔一个吻。

sentences.english: By the time the police arrived, the men had flown.
sentences.chinese: 警察赶到时，那些人已经逃走了。

detailed_translations.english: to move somewhere quickly and suddenly

name: official
trans: Official means being authorized or approved by a person or organization in a position of authority.

sentences.english: an official investigation into the causes of the explosion
sentences.chinese: 对此次爆炸事件原因的官方调查

sentences.english: the official policy on education
sentences.chinese: 官方的教育政策

sentences.english: official statistics about illegal drug use
sentences.chinese: 非法使用毒品的官方统计数据

sentences.english: You will have to get official permission first.
sentences.chinese: 你必须先得到正式许可。

sentences.english: Finally the letter of appointment came, making it all official.
sentences.chinese: 任命书终于来了，这样一切都名正言顺了。

detailed_translations.english: approved of or done by someone in authority, especially the government

detailed_translations.chinese: 官员， 行政人员， 高级人员
detailed_translations.english: someone who is in a position of authority in an organization

name: broad
trans: Broad means wide in extent or scope, or including a wide variety of things.

sentences.english: We went along a broad passage.
sentences.chinese: 我们走在一条宽阔的走廊上。

sentences.english: He was six feet tall, with broad shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 他身高六英尺，肩膀宽阔。

detailed_translations.english: a road, river, or part of someone’s body etc that is broad is wide

name: comfortable
trans: Comfortable means providing physical or psychological ease and relaxation.

sentences.english: The bed wasn’t particularly comfortable.
sentences.chinese: 这床不大舒服。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel physically relaxed, without any pain or without being too hot, cold etc

name: gain
trans: To gain is to obtain or acquire something, often through effort or hard work.

sentences.english: After gaining independence in 1957, it was renamed ‘Ghana’.
sentences.chinese: 1957年获得独立后，该国改名为“加纳”。

sentences.english: Carrie’s gained a lot of weight recently.
sentences.chinese: 卡丽的体重最近增加了很多。

sentences.english: The Democratic Party needed a net gain of only 20 votes.
sentences.chinese: 民主党只需要增20张选票。

detailed_translations.english: to obtain or achieve something you want or need
an increase in the amount or level of something

name: maybe
trans: Maybe means perhaps, possibly or it could be.

sentences.english: Maybe it’s all just a big misunderstanding.
sentences.chinese: 也许这只是一个很大的误会。

sentences.english: ‘Do you think he’ll come back?’ ‘Maybe.’
sentences.chinese: “你认为他会回来吗？”“也许会吧。”

sentences.english: Maybe they’re right, but maybe not .
sentences.chinese: 也许他们是对的，但也许不是。

sentences.english: You have talent, maybe even genius.
sentences.chinese: 你很有才能，甚至可以说有天赋。

sentences.english: He said he’d finish the work soon – maybe tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 他说他很快就会完成那项工作——也许是明天。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that something may happen or may be true but you are not certain

name: rich
trans: Rich means having a lot of money or valuable possessions.

sentences.english: Rich mineral deposits have been found in the sea bed.
sentences.chinese: 海底发现有丰富的矿床。

sentences.english: Red meat is a rich source of iron.
sentences.chinese: 红肉含有大量铁质。

sentences.english: This is a system in which the rich are taken care of and the poor are left to suffer.
sentences.chinese: 这是个富人受关照，而穷人遭罪的制度。

detailed_translations.english: containing a lot of something

detailed_translations.chinese: (Rich)人名；(丹)里克；(捷)里赫；(英、西)里奇；(葡、法)里什
detailed_translations.english: The rich are rich people

name: save
trans: To save means to keep something for future use or to rescue someone or something from harm.

sentences.english: We’ll save a lot of time if we go by car.
sentences.chinese: 我们要是开车去，可以节省很多时间。

sentences.english: Everyone is being encouraged to save energy.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都被鼓励节约能源。

sentences.english: ways to save money on heating bills
sentences.chinese: 节省取暖费的种种办法

detailed_translations.english: to use less money, time, energy etc so that you do not waste any

name: stand
trans: To stand means to be upright on your feet or to take a position or viewpoint.

sentences.english: It looks like we’ll have to stand – there are no seats left.
sentences.chinese: 看来我们只能站着——没有座位了。

sentences.english: She stood in the doorway.
sentences.chinese: 她站在门口。

sentences.english: (= do not move ) and listen to me.
sentences.chinese: 站好别动，听我说。

sentences.english: Don’t just stand there (= stand and not do anything ) – help me!
sentences.chinese: 不要光站在那里，帮帮我！

detailed_translations.english: to support yourself on your feet or be in an upright position
used to say that you do not like someone or something at all, or that you think that something is extremely unpleasant
a piece of furniture or equipment used to hold or support something

name: young
trans: Young means being in the early stage of life or growth or having little experience.

sentences.english: a young child
sentences.chinese: 幼儿

sentences.english: He’s younger than me.
sentences.chinese: 他比我小。

sentences.english: You’re too young to get married.
sentences.chinese: 你还太小，不能结婚。

sentences.english: young trees
sentences.chinese: 小树

sentences.english: When I was young, I wanted to be a model.
sentences.chinese: 我年轻时候想当模特。

sentences.english: John was a great footballer in his younger days(= when he was younger ).
sentences.chinese: 约翰年轻时是个很棒的足球运动员。

detailed_translations.chinese: 年轻的；初期的；没有经验的
detailed_translations.english: a young person, plant, or animal has not lived for very long
young people

name: fail
trans: To fail means to be unsuccessful in doing something or to not meet expectations.

sentences.english: It looks likely that the peace talks will fail.
sentences.chinese: 看来和平谈判可能会失败。

sentences.english: Millions of people have tried to quit smoking and failed miserably (= been completely unsuccessful ).
sentences.chinese: 数百万人戒过烟，都以惨败告终。

sentences.english: his efforts to save his failing marriage
sentences.chinese: 他挽救自己濒危婚姻的努力

sentences.english: The brakes on my bike failed half way down the hill.
sentences.chinese: 我骑自行车下山到中途刹车失灵了。

detailed_translations.english: to not succeed in achieving something

name: heavy
trans: Heavy means having a lot of weight or being difficult to lift or move.

sentences.english: The wardrobe was too heavy for me to move on my own.
sentences.chinese: 衣橱太重，我一个人移不动。

sentences.english: a heavy suitcase
sentences.chinese: 沉重的手提箱

sentences.english: The males are seven times heavier than the females.
sentences.chinese: 雄性的重量是雌性的七倍。

sentences.english: Heavy rain has caused flooding in many areas.
sentences.chinese: 大雨在很多地区造成水灾。

sentences.english: The apple trees were heavy with fruit.
sentences.chinese: 苹果树上果实累累。

detailed_translations.english: weighing a lot

name: hello
trans: Hello is a greeting used when you meet or speak to someone.

sentences.english: Hello, John! How are you?
sentences.chinese: 喂，约翰！你好吗？

sentences.english: Stanley, come and say hello to your nephew.
sentences.chinese: 斯坦利，过来和你的侄子打声招呼。

sentences.english: Well, hello there ! I haven’t seen you for ages.
sentences.chinese: 嗨，你好！好久不见了。

detailed_translations.english: used as a greeting when you see or meet someone

detailed_translations.chinese: 表示问候， 惊奇或唤起注意时的用语

name: lead
trans: To lead means to guide or direct a group of people or to be in charge of something.

sentences.english: drinking water supplied by old-fashioned lead pipes
sentences.chinese: 由老式铅管输送的饮用水

detailed_translations.english: a chemical element. Lead is a heavy soft grey metal, used especially in the past for water pipes or to cover roofs.

name: listen
trans: To listen means to pay attention to someone or something that is speaking or making a sound.

sentences.english: Listen! There’s a strange noise in the engine.
sentences.chinese: 听！引擎发出奇怪的声音。

sentences.english: I told him not to go, but he just wouldn’t listen.
sentences.chinese: 我叫他不要去，可他就是不听。

detailed_translations.english: to pay attention to what someone is saying or to a sound that you can hear

name: valuable
trans: Valuable means having a high worth in money or being very useful or important.

name: worry
trans: To worry means to feel anxious or concerned about something or someone.

sentences.english: He’s been a constant source of worry .
sentences.chinese: 他总是让人担心。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being anxious about something
to be anxious or unhappy about someone or something, so that you think about them a lot

name: handle
trans: To handle means to manage or deal with something or to hold or touch something with your hands.

sentences.english: I handled most of the paperwork.
sentences.chinese: 大部分文书工作是我做的。

sentences.english: The case is being handled by a top lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 此案正由一位顶尖律师负责处理。

sentences.english: The finance department handles all the accounts.
sentences.chinese: 财务部处理所有账目。

sentences.english: Computers can handle huge amounts of data.
sentences.chinese: 计算机能处理大量数据。

detailed_translations.english: to do the things that are necessary to complete a job

name: leading
trans: Leading means being in the front or having the most important position or influence.

sentences.english: The army played a leading role in organizing the attempted coup.
sentences.chinese: 军队在策划这场未遂政变的过程中起了最主要的作用。

sentences.english: the leading industrial nations
sentences.chinese: 主要的工业国

sentences.english: a leading heart specialist
sentences.chinese: 最好的心脏病专家

sentences.english: leading members of the government
sentences.chinese: 政府要员

detailed_translations.english: best, most important, or most successful

name: meet
trans: To meet means to come together or be introduced to someone for the first time.

sentences.english: You’ll never guess who I met in town.
sentences.chinese: 你绝对猜不出我在镇上碰到谁了。

sentences.english: I was worried I might meet Henry on the bus.
sentences.chinese: 我担心可能会在公共汽车上遇到亨利。

detailed_translations.english: to see someone by chance and talk to them
to see someone by chance and talk to them

name: release
trans: To release means to set something free or to make something available to the public.

sentences.english: Police arrested several men, who were later released.
sentences.chinese: 警察逮捕了几个人，后来都释放了。

sentences.english: The bears are eventually released into the wild.
sentences.chinese: 这些熊最后被放回野生环境中。

sentences.english: You need to release the tension in these shoulder muscles.
sentences.chinese: 你需要放松肩部肌肉。

sentences.english: The new trade figures have just been released.
sentences.chinese: 新的贸易数字刚刚公布。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone go free, after having kept them somewhere

name: sell
trans: To sell means to exchange something for money or to convince someone to buy something.

sentences.english: If you offer him another hundred, I think he’ll sell.
sentences.chinese: 如果你再加一百元钱，我想他会卖的。

sentences.english: He regrets selling all his old records.
sentences.chinese: 他后悔把所有的老唱片都卖掉了。

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone in exchange for money

name: finish
trans: To finish means to complete or bring something to an end.

sentences.english: You can’t go anywhere until you’ve finished your homework.
sentences.chinese: 没完成家庭作业前你哪儿也不能去。

sentences.english: Have you finished that book yet?
sentences.chinese: 那本书你看完了吗？

sentences.english: ‘How’s the decorating going?’ ‘We’ve nearly finished.’
sentences.chinese: “装修进行得怎么样了？”“差不多快完成了。”

sentences.english: The football season finishes in May.
sentences.chinese: 足球赛季在 5 月份结束。

sentences.english: a dramatic finish to the race
sentences.chinese: 赛跑的戏剧性结局

detailed_translations.english: to complete the last part of something that you are doing
the end or last part of something

name: normal
trans: Normal means being typical or expected or not having any significant deviations.

sentences.english: A normal working week is 40 hours.
sentences.chinese: 一个正常的工作周是40小时。

sentences.english: She was assessed in the normal way, and placed on the waiting list.
sentences.chinese: 她接受了正常的评估后被列入等候名单。

sentences.english: All I want is to lead a normal life.
sentences.chinese: 我想要的只是能过正常的生活。

detailed_translations.english: usual, typical, or expected

name: press
trans: To press means to apply force or pressure to something or to urge someone to do something.

sentences.english: Oxford University Press
sentences.chinese: 牛津大学出版社

sentences.english: We were able to watch the books rolling off the presses.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以看到书本从印刷机上源源不断地印出。

detailed_translations.english: a business that prints and publishes books

name: ride
trans: To ride means to travel on something, such as a vehicle or animal, by sitting on it.

sentences.english: She learned to ride when she was seven.
sentences.chinese: 她七岁时学会了骑马。

sentences.english: He was riding a large grey mare.
sentences.chinese: 他骑着一匹灰色的大母马。

sentences.english: He prefers travelling on the subway to riding in a limousine.
sentences.chinese: 他宁愿乘坐地铁出行而不愿乘坐豪华加长轿车。

sentences.english: She took some friends for a ride in the family car.
sentences.chinese: 她用私家车载了朋友们一程。

detailed_translations.english: to sit on an animal, especially a horse, and make it move along
a trip on a horse or bicycle, or in a vehicle.

name: secret
trans: Secret means being kept hidden or not known by others or having confidential information.

sentences.english: I can’t tell you. It’s a secret.
sentences.chinese: 我不能告诉你，这是个秘密。

sentences.english: It was no secret that the two men hated each other.
sentences.chinese: 这两个男人相互仇视，这算不得什么秘密。

sentences.english: Don’t worry. Your secret is safe with me (= I won’t tell anyone about it ) .
sentences.chinese: 别担心，我会替你保守秘密。

sentences.english: Your hair always looks so great – what’s your secret ?
sentences.chinese: 你的头发看起来总是很漂亮——你的秘诀是什么？

sentences.english: They kept their relationship secret from their parents.
sentences.chinese: 他们俩的关系瞒着父母。

detailed_translations.english: something that is kept hidden or that is known about by only a few people
known about by only a few people and kept hidden from others

name: spread
trans: To spread means to make something cover a larger area or to distribute something over a surface.

sentences.english: The cancer had spread to her liver.
sentences.chinese: 癌已经扩散到她的肝脏。

sentences.english: The news spread like wildfire.
sentences.chinese: 消息如野火般迅速传开。

detailed_translations.english: if something spreads or is spread, it becomes larger or moves so that it affects more people or a larger area

name: spring
trans: Spring means the season between winter and summer or a coil or elastic object that can be stretched and then returns to its original shape.

sentences.english: He sprang to his feet (= stood up suddenly ) and rushed after her.
sentences.chinese: 他腾地站起身，冲过去追她。

sentences.english: There are several hot springs in the area.
sentences.chinese: 这地区有几处温泉。

sentences.english: With a spring, the cat leapt on to the table.
sentences.chinese: 猫一跃跳上桌子。

detailed_translations.english: to move suddenly and quickly in a particular direction, especially by jumping
a place where water comes up naturally from the ground

name: tough
trans: Tough means difficult or strong or able to withstand hardship or pain.

sentences.english: It was a tough race.
sentences.chinese: 比赛打得很艰难。

sentences.english: She’s had a tough life.
sentences.chinese: 她的生活十分艰辛。

sentences.english: The company admitted that it had been a tough year.
sentences.chinese: 公司承认那是艰难的一年。

sentences.english: Tough decisions will have to be made.
sentences.chinese: 必须作出艰难的决定。

sentences.english: The reporters were asking a lot of tough questions .
sentences.chinese: 记者们问了很多难以回答的问题。

sentences.english: (= a difficult decision ) , but we had to cancel the game because of the weather.
sentences.chinese: 尽管是一个艰难的决定，但由于天气不好我们只得取消比赛。

sentences.english: I find his books pretty tough going (= difficult to read ) .
sentences.chinese: 我发现他的书很难读。

sentences.english: Gage predicted the president’s proposal would be a tough sell (= something that is difficult to persuade someone about ) before Congress.
sentences.chinese: 盖奇预言总统的提议在国会很难通过。

detailed_translations.english: difficult to do or deal with

name: wait
trans: To wait means to stay in one place until something happens or someone arrives.

sentences.english: Hurry up! Everyone’s waiting.
sentences.chinese: 快点！大家在等着呢。

sentences.english: Would you mind waiting outside?
sentences.chinese: 你在外面等好吗？

sentences.english: We’ve been waiting ages.
sentences.chinese: 我们已经等了很长时间了。

detailed_translations.english: to stay somewhere or not do something until something else happens, someone arrives etc
a period of time in which you wait for something to happen, someone to arrive etc

name: brown
trans: Brown is a color that is darker than yellow or beige.

sentences.english: This particular model is available in brown, white, or grey.
sentences.chinese: 这个型号的产品有棕色、白色和灰色的。

sentences.english: the browns and greens of the landscape
sentences.chinese: 棕绿相映的风景

detailed_translations.english: the colour of earth, wood, or coffee

name: deep
trans: Deep means going far down or being far from the surface.

sentences.english: a deep narrow valley
sentences.chinese: 又深又窄的山谷

sentences.english: a deep wound
sentences.chinese: 很深的伤口

sentences.english: She was sitting in a deep leather chair.
sentences.chinese: 她坐在一张很深的皮椅子里。

detailed_translations.english: going far down from the top or from the surface

name: display
trans: To display is to show something for others to see.

sentences.english: a dazzling display (= very good display ) of flowers
sentences.chinese: 令人目眩神迷的花卉展

sentences.english: The window display caught her eye.
sentences.chinese: 橱窗陈列吸引了她的目光。

sentences.english: shop windows displaying the latest fashions
sentences.chinese: 展示最新时装的商店橱窗

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement of things for people to look at or buy
to show something to people, or put it in a place where people can see it easily

name: flow
trans: Flow is the movement of a liquid or gas.

sentences.english: a new road system to improve traffic flow through the city centre
sentences.chinese: 疏导市中心车流的新道路系统

sentences.english: These gates regulate the amount of water flowing into the canal.
sentences.chinese: 这些闸门调节流入运河的水量。

detailed_translations.english: a smooth steady movement of liquid, gas, or electricity
when a liquid, gas, or electricity flows, it moves in a steady continuous stream

name: hit
trans: To hit is to strike something with force.

sentences.english: Which band had a hit with ‘Bohemian Rhapsody’?
sentences.chinese: 《波希米亚狂想曲》是哪支乐队风行一时的歌曲？

detailed_translations.english: something such as a film, play, song etc that is very popular and successful

name: objective
trans: An objective is a goal or purpose.

sentences.english: He vowed to achieve certain objectives before the end of his presidency.
sentences.chinese: 他立誓要在他的总统任期结束之前实现某些目标。

sentences.english: the best way to accomplish your objectives
sentences.chinese: 完成目标的最佳方法

sentences.english: The degree program has two main objectives.
sentences.chinese: 该学位课程有两个主要目标。

sentences.english: Managers should set specific performance objectives for their teams.
sentences.chinese: 经理应该为自己的团队制定明确的绩效目标。

sentences.english: The main objective was to improve children’s knowledge of geography.
sentences.chinese: 主要目的是要增长儿童的地理知识。

sentences.english: A clear objective was set and adhered to.
sentences.chinese: 定下了明确的目标并坚持到底。

sentences.english: One of your first business objectives should be to get your own office.
sentences.chinese: 你的首要工作目标之一应该是拥有自己的办公室。

detailed_translations.english: something that you are trying hard to achieve, especially in business or politics

name: shoot
trans: To shoot is to fire a weapon or take a photograph.

sentences.english: Police shot one suspect when he pulled a gun on them.
sentences.chinese: 警方在一名嫌疑人拔枪指着他们时击毙了他。

sentences.english: Smith killed his wife, and then shot himself.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯杀死妻子，然后开枪自杀。

sentences.english: A woman was shot dead in an attempted robbery.
sentences.chinese: 一名女子在一桩未遂抢劫案中中枪身亡。

sentences.english: The guards have orders to shoot intruders on sight (= shoot them as soon as they see them ) .
sentences.chinese: 卫兵们奉命一见到有人闯入就开枪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 射击，射中；拍摄；发芽；使爆炸；给…注射
detailed_translations.english: to deliberately kill or injure someone using a gun
an occasion when someone takes photographs or makes a film

name: touch
trans: To touch is to come into contact with something.

sentences.english: She reached out to touch his arm.
sentences.chinese: 她伸手去碰他的胳膊。

sentences.english: If your house has been burgled, you shouldn’t touch anything until the police arrive.
sentences.chinese: 如果家中被盗，在警察赶到之前不要动任何物品。

sentences.english: ‘Don’t touch me!’ she yelled.
sentences.chinese: “别碰我！”她大叫道。

sentences.english: Her plight has touched the hearts of people around the world.
sentences.chinese: 她的困境触动了全世界人的心弦。

sentences.english: She felt a gentle touch on her shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 她感到有人轻轻碰了一下她的肩膀。

detailed_translations.english: to put your hand, finger etc on someone or something
the action of putting your hand, finger, or another part of your body on something or someone

name: cancel
trans: To cancel is to stop or annul something.

sentences.english: Our flight was cancelled.
sentences.chinese: 我们的航班取消了。

sentences.english: I’m afraid I’ll have to cancel our meeting tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕我得取消我们明天的会议。

sentences.english: You’ll just have to ring John and cancel.
sentences.chinese: 你只能打电话给约翰取消了。

detailed_translations.english: to decide that something that was officially planned will not happen

name: chemical
trans: A chemical is a substance made up of different molecules.

sentences.english: the chemical composition of bleach
sentences.chinese: 漂白剂的化学成分

sentences.english: a chemical analysis of the soil
sentences.chinese: 对土壤的化学分析

sentences.english: synthetic chemicals
sentences.chinese: 合成化学品

detailed_translations.english: relating to substances, the study of substances, or processes involving changes in substances
relating to substances, the study of substances, or processes involving changes in substances

name: cry
trans: To cry is to shed tears as an emotional response.

sentences.english: Don’t cry, Laura. It’ll be OK.
sentences.chinese: 不要哭，劳拉，没事的。

sentences.english: Upstairs, a baby began to cry.
sentences.chinese: 楼上有个婴儿开始哭起来。

sentences.english: Jamie looked like he’d been crying.
sentences.chinese: 杰米看上去好像哭过了。

sentences.english: I just couldn’t stop crying.
sentences.chinese: 我就是哭个不停。

sentences.english: That film always makes me cry .
sentences.chinese: 那部影片总是让我落泪。

sentences.english: Oliver, alone, began to cry bitterly (= cry a lot ) .
sentences.chinese: 奥利弗独自一人，开始伤心地哭了。

sentences.english: ‘Stop!’ she cried.
sentences.chinese: “停下！”她喊道。

detailed_translations.english: to produce tears from your eyes, usually because you are unhappy or hurt

name: dump
trans: To dump is to get rid of something in a careless way.

sentences.english: We dumped our bags at the nearby Grand Hotel and hurried toward the market.
sentences.chinese: 我们把包扔在附近的格兰德旅馆，急匆匆地向市场赶去。

sentences.english: a campaign to stop cheap European beef being dumped in West Africa
sentences.chinese: 阻止在西非倾销廉价欧洲牛肉的运动

detailed_translations.english: If you dump something somewhere, you put it or unload it there quickly and carelessly.

name: extreme
trans: Extreme means being very far from the usual or ordinary.

sentences.english: Extreme poverty still exists in many rural areas.
sentences.chinese: 许多农村地区仍处于赤贫状态。

sentences.english: extreme cold
sentences.chinese: 严寒

sentences.english: He had extreme difficulty getting hold of the ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 他费了极大的劲找配料。

detailed_translations.english: very great in degree
a situation, quality etc which is as great as it can possibly be – used especially when talking about two opposites

name: push
trans: To push is to apply force to move something away.

sentences.english: It didn’t move, so she pushed harder.
sentences.chinese: 它一动不动，因此她加力去推。

sentences.english: I promised to push him on the swings for as long as he wanted.
sentences.chinese: 我答应他想在秋千上荡多久我就推多久。

sentences.english: shoppers pushing their grocery carts
sentences.chinese: 推着购物车的购物者

detailed_translations.english: to make someone or something move by pressing them with your hands, arms etc
to make someone or something move by pressing them with your hands, arms etc

name: conflict
trans: A conflict is a disagreement or struggle between people or groups.

sentences.english: the threat of industrial conflict in the coalfields
sentences.chinese: 煤田发生劳资纠纷的风险

sentences.english: Marx points out the potential conflicts below the surface of society.
sentences.chinese: 马克思指出了隐藏在社会表层之下的潜在矛盾。

sentences.english: His views on the literal truth of the Bible brought him into conflict with other Christian leaders.
sentences.chinese: 他坚持《圣经》字面真理的观点使他与其他的基督教领袖发生了冲突。

sentences.english: Doctors exercise considerable power and often come into conflict with politicians.
sentences.chinese: 医生行使很大的权力，常常和政客们发生冲突。

sentences.english: a lawyer specializing in conflict resolution
sentences.chinese: 专门解决纠纷的律师

detailed_translations.english: a state of disagreement or argument between people, groups, countries etc

name: eat
trans: To eat is to consume food.

sentences.english: Felix chatted cheerfully as he ate.
sentences.chinese: 费利克斯一边吃一边兴奋地聊天。

sentences.english: A small girl was eating an ice cream.
sentences.chinese: 一个小女孩在吃冰激凌。

sentences.english: We had plenty to eat and drink.
sentences.chinese: 我们有很多吃的喝的。

sentences.english: It’s important to eat healthily when you are pregnant.
sentences.chinese: 怀孕的时候吃得健康很重要。

sentences.english: I exercise and eat right and get plenty of sleep.
sentences.chinese: 我做运动，饮食得当，睡眠充足。

sentences.english: Would you like something to eat?
sentences.chinese: 想吃点什么吗？

sentences.english: She can eat like a horse and never put on weight.
sentences.chinese: 她可以吃得很多，但体重从来不会增加。

sentences.english: We stopped at McDonalds to get a bite to eat.
sentences.chinese: 我们在麦当劳停下来吃点东西。

sentences.english: Good eating habits are the best way of preventing infection.
sentences.chinese: 良好的饮食习惯是预防感染的最佳方法。

sentences.english: ‘More cake?’ ‘No thanks, I couldn’t eat another thing.’
sentences.chinese: “再来点蛋糕？” “不要了，谢谢。 我再也吃不下了。”

sentences.english: No chicken for me. I don’t eat meat (= I never eat meat ).
sentences.chinese: 我不要鸡肉，我不吃肉的。

sentences.english: Does Rob eat fish?
sentences.chinese: 罗布吃鱼吗？

detailed_translations.english: to put food in your mouth and chew and swallow it
to put food in your mouth and chew and swallow it

name: fill
trans: To fill is to put something into a space until it is full.

sentences.english: He poured her a drink, then filled his own glass.
sentences.chinese: 他给她倒了一杯，然后将自己的杯子斟满。

sentences.english: My job was filling the flour sacks.
sentences.chinese: 我的工作是装面粉袋。

sentences.english: Take a deep breath and allow your lungs to fill.
sentences.chinese: 深吸一口气，让肺部涨满。

sentences.english: There was just enough wind to fill the sails.
sentences.chinese: 正好有足够大的风鼓满船帆。

sentences.english: Miller’s band was filling dance halls (= attracting a lot of people ) all over the country.
sentences.chinese: 米勒的乐队在全国各地的舞厅都人气爆棚。

sentences.english: Numerous pictures fill every available space.
sentences.chinese: 密密麻麻的照片填满了每一块空处。

detailed_translations.english: if a container or place fills, or if you fill it, enough of something goes into it to make it full

name: formal
trans: Formal means following established rules or customs.

sentences.english: formal recognition of the reformed church
sentences.chinese: 改革后的教会所获得的官方承认

sentences.english: a formal agreement between the countries
sentences.chinese: 两国间的正式协议

sentences.english: There is no formal structure for negotiating pay increases.
sentences.chinese: 加薪谈判没有正式的框架可循。

detailed_translations.english: made or done officially or publicly

name: jump
trans: To jump is to propel oneself upward by pushing off the ground.

sentences.english: The cats jumped down and came to meet us.
sentences.chinese: 这些猫跳下来，过来迎接我们。

detailed_translations.english: to let yourself drop from a place that is above the ground
to let yourself drop from a place that is above the ground

name: kick
trans: To kick is to strike with the foot.

sentences.english: He kicked the door hard.
sentences.chinese: 他用力踢门。

sentences.english: The boys were kicking a ball around in the yard.
sentences.chinese: 男孩们在院子里踢球。

sentences.english: She gave him a kick on the shin.
sentences.chinese: 她朝他的小腿踢了一脚。

detailed_translations.english: to hit sb/sth with your foot
a movement with the foot or the leg, usually to hit sth with the foot

name: opposite
trans: Opposite means being completely different or contrary.

sentences.english: I thought the medicine would make him sleep, but it had the opposite effect.
sentences.chinese: 我以为这药会让他睡觉，但是它却起了反作用。

sentences.english: At the opposite extreme, Ashworth’s style is very simple and modern.
sentences.chinese: 截然相反的是，阿什沃思的风格非常简单和现代。

sentences.english: Bob was quicker than Ed? It’s usually the opposite way round.
sentences.chinese: 鲍勃比埃德快？通常是反过来的。

detailed_translations.english: as different as possible from something else
a person or thing that is as different as possible from someone or something else

name: pass
trans: To pass is to move past or go beyond something.

sentences.english: The crowd parted to let the truck pass.
sentences.chinese: 人群分开让卡车通过。

sentences.english: He gave me a smile as he passed.
sentences.chinese: 他经过时对我微笑了一下。

sentences.english: We passed a group of students outside the theatre.
sentences.chinese: 我们在戏院外从一群学生身旁经过。

sentences.english: I pass the sports centre on the way to work.
sentences.chinese: 我上班的路上经过体育中心。

sentences.english: The road passes right through the town centre.
sentences.chinese: 那条路正好穿过镇中心。

sentences.english: We passed the winter pleasantly enough.
sentences.chinese: 我们相当愉快地度过了那个冬季。

detailed_translations.english: to come up to a particular place, person, or object and go past them

name: pitch
trans: A pitch is a throw or toss of an object.

sentences.english: She crumpled up the page and pitched it into the fire.
sentences.chinese: 她把那页纸揉成团，扔进了火里。

detailed_translations.chinese: 投掷， 扔； 猛然倒下； (船、 飞机)颠簸
detailed_translations.english: to fall or be moved suddenly in a particular direction, or to make someone or something do this

detailed_translations.chinese: 球场；程度，强度；高度，高音；沥青；顶点
detailed_translations.english: a marked out area of ground on which a sport is played

detailed_translations.chinese: 销售；投掷，扔；使猛然倒下；表达；把…定于特定程度；定调；架设，搭，营
detailed_translations.english: to fall or be moved suddenly in a particular direction, or to make someone or something do this

name: remote
trans: Remote means being far away or distant.

sentences.english: a remote border town
sentences.chinese: 一个偏远的边境小镇

sentences.english: a fire in a remote mountain area
sentences.chinese: 偏远山区的火灾

detailed_translations.chinese: 遥远的， 偏僻的； 关系疏远的； 脱离的； 绝少的； 微乎其微的； 孤高的， 冷淡的
detailed_translations.english: far from towns or other places where people live

name: total
trans: Total means being the complete amount or sum.

sentences.english: a total ban on cigarette advertising
sentences.chinese: 香烟广告的全面禁止

sentences.english: He looked at her with a total lack of comprehension.
sentences.chinese: 他一头雾水地望着她。

sentences.english: a sport that demands total commitment
sentences.chinese: 需要全身心投入的体育运动

detailed_translations.english: complete, or as great as is possible
to reach a particular total

name: treat
trans: To treat means to act a certain way towards someone or something, often in a kind or generous manner.

sentences.english: She treats me like one of the family.
sentences.chinese: 她把我当作家人看待。

sentences.english: sewage treated so that it can be used as fertilizer
sentences.chinese: 经过处理可用作肥料的污水

sentences.english: Let's go out for lunch─ my treat (= I will pay) .
sentences.chinese: 咱们到外面去吃午餐，我请客。

detailed_translations.english: to behave towards someone or something in a particular way
something special that you give someone or do for them because you know they will enjoy it

name: vast
trans: Vast means something that is very large in size or extent.

sentences.english: The refugees come across the border in vast numbers.
sentences.chinese: 大量难民涌过边境。

sentences.english: In the past five years, there has been a vast improvement in graduation rates.
sentences.chinese: 过去的五年内，毕业率大幅度提高。

detailed_translations.chinese: 巨大的， 大量的； 浩瀚的
detailed_translations.english: extremely large

name: abuse
trans: Abuse means to use something or someone in a harmful or cruel way.

sentences.english: several cases of child abuse
sentences.chinese: 数宗虐待儿童案

sentences.english: An independent committee will look into alleged human rights abuses.
sentences.chinese: 一个独立委员会将对涉嫌践踏人权的行为进行调查。

detailed_translations.english: cruel or violent treatment of someone
to deliberately use something for the wrong purpose or for your own advantage

name: beat
trans: To beat means to strike repeatedly, usually with the intention of causing harm or injury.

sentences.english: Somebody was beating at the door.
sentences.chinese: 有人在打门。

sentences.english: Brazil were beaten 2–1.
sentences.chinese: 巴西队以1比2告负。

sentences.english: Labour easily beat the Conservatives in the last election.
sentences.chinese: 工党在上一届选举中轻松击败保守党。

detailed_translations.english: to hit sb/sth many times, usually very hard

name: burn
trans: To burn means to use fire or heat to destroy something.

sentences.english: I burnt all his old letters.
sentences.chinese: 我把他以前的信全烧了。

sentences.english: Cars were burned and shops were looted during the rioting.
sentences.chinese: 暴乱期间，汽车被焚，商店遭抢劫。

sentences.english: The Grand Hotel had burnt to the ground .
sentences.chinese: 格兰德大酒店被大火夷为平地。

sentences.english: Make sure the iron isn’t too hot or you’ll burn the cloth.
sentences.chinese: 注意熨斗温度不能过高，免得烫坏布料。

sentences.english: He dropped his cigarette and burnt a hole in the carpet.
sentences.chinese: 他的香烟掉下来，把地毯烫了一个洞。

detailed_translations.chinese: 燃烧；烧毁，灼伤；激起…的愤怒
detailed_translations.english: to destroy or damage something with fire
an injury caused by fire, heat, the light of the sun, or acid

name: deposit
trans: To deposit means to put something in a specific place or location.

sentences.english: You are advised to deposit your valuables in the hotel safe.
sentences.chinese: 建议您把贵重物品存到酒店保险箱里。

sentences.english: As the river slows down, it deposits a layer of soil.
sentences.chinese: 河水流速变慢时，一层泥土便沉积下来。

sentences.english: I’d like to make a deposit (= pay some money ) into my savings account.
sentences.chinese: 我想存一笔钱到我的储蓄账户里。

sentences.english: fatty deposits on the heart
sentences.chinese: 心脏上沉积的脂肪层

detailed_translations.english: to put money or something valuable in a bank or other place where it will be safe
an amount of money that is paid into a bank account

name: print
trans: To print means to create a copy of something on paper or another material.

sentences.english: Over five million copies of the paper are printed every day.
sentences.chinese: 这份报纸每日印量超过五百万。

sentences.english: When the book was first written no publisher would print it.
sentences.chinese: 这本书刚写成时没有出版商愿意出版。

sentences.english: There was no print at all on the backs of the tickets.
sentences.chinese: 门票背面没有印任何文字。

detailed_translations.english: to produce many printed copies of a book, newspaper etc
writing that has been printed, for example in books or newspapers

name: raise
trans: To raise means to lift or elevate something to a higher position.

sentences.english: He did not raise the subject again.
sentences.chinese: 他再也没有提起这个话题。

sentences.english: I’d like to raise the issue of publicity.
sentences.chinese: 我想提一提宣传问题。

sentences.english: Betty raised the important question of who will be in charge.
sentences.chinese: 贝蒂提出了一个重要问题，就是将由谁来负责。

detailed_translations.english: to begin to talk or write about a subject that you want to be considered or a question that you think should be answered

name: sleep
trans: To sleep means to rest and be in a state of unconsciousness for a period of time.

sentences.english: I usually sleep on my back.
sentences.chinese: 我一般仰卧着睡觉。

sentences.english: Did you sleep well?
sentences.chinese: 你睡得好吗？

sentences.english: He’s lucky because at least he has somewhere to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 他算是幸运的，至少还有个睡觉的地方。

detailed_translations.english: to rest your mind and body, usually at night when you are lying in bed with your eyes closed
the natural state of resting your mind and body, usually at night

name: somewhere
trans: Somewhere refers to a place that is not specified or known.

sentences.english: My wallet must be around here somewhere.
sentences.chinese: 我的钱包肯定是在这里的什么地方。

sentences.english: We could meet for dinner at Giorgio’s or somewhere (= or a similar place ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们可以在乔治家或别的什么地方一起吃饭。

detailed_translations.english: in or to a place, but you do not say or know exactly where

name: advance
trans: To advance means to move forward or progress in some way.

sentences.english: I should warn you in advance that I’m not a very good dancer.
sentences.chinese: 我要先提醒你，我跳舞不是很好。

sentences.english: Many thanks, in advance, for your help.
sentences.chinese: 对你的帮助预先表示万分感谢。

sentences.english: Could you distribute copies well in advance of the meeting?
sentences.chinese: 开会前把复印件早早分发下去，好吗？

sentences.english: A line of US tanks slowly advanced.
sentences.chinese: 一列美军坦克缓缓前进。

detailed_translations.english: before something happens or is expected to happen
to move towards someone or something, especially in a slow and determined way – used especially to talk about soldiers

name: anywhere
trans: Anywhere refers to any place at all, without being specific.

sentences.english: I haven't got anywhere to live.
sentences.chinese: 我没有任何地方住。

detailed_translations.english: in or to any place

name: consist
trans: To consist means to be composed or made up of certain elements or parts.

sentences.english: My diet consisted almost exclusively of chocolate-covered cookies and glasses of milk.
sentences.chinese: 我的饮食几乎只包含裹上巧克力的曲奇饼和一杯杯牛奶。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由…组成； 在于； 一致

name: dark
trans: Dark refers to the absence or very low level of light.

sentences.english: The church was dark and quiet.
sentences.chinese: 教堂里黑魆魆的，寂静无声。

sentences.english: the dark winter days
sentences.chinese: 阴暗的冬日

sentences.english: Suddenly, the room went dark (= became dark ) .
sentences.chinese: 房间突然变暗了。

sentences.english: (= night begins ) about ten o’clock.
sentences.chinese: 大约十点钟开始天黑。

sentences.english: It was still dark (= was night ) when we boarded the train.
sentences.chinese: 我们上火车时天还是黑的。

sentences.english: It was pitch dark (= completely dark ) in the attic.
sentences.chinese: 阁楼上漆黑一片。

detailed_translations.english: if it is dark, there is little or no light

name: double
trans: Double means two times the amount or quantity of something.

sentences.english: a double sink
sentences.chinese: 双水槽

sentences.english: a double wardrobe
sentences.chinese: 双门衣柜

sentences.english: the great double doors of the cathedral
sentences.chinese: 大教堂宏伟的双开大门

sentences.english: Don’t park your car on double yellow lines.
sentences.chinese: 不可以在双黄线处停车。

sentences.english: The city was enclosed by walls of double thickness.
sentences.chinese: 该城被两倍厚的墙围了起来。

detailed_translations.english: consisting of two parts that are similar or exactly the same

name: draw
trans: To draw means to make a picture or image by using a pen, pencil, or other instrument.

sentences.english: Katie had drawn a cottage with a little stream running next to it.
sentences.chinese: 凯蒂画了一间小茅舍，旁边流淌着一条小溪。

sentences.english: She asked the little girl to draw a picture of the man she’d spoken to.
sentences.chinese: 她让小女孩把刚才和她说话的那个男人画出来。

sentences.english: Keith was drawing a complicated-looking graph.
sentences.chinese: 基思在画一张看上去很复杂的图表。

sentences.english: I’ve never been able to draw very well.
sentences.chinese: 我从来就画不好图画。

detailed_translations.english: to produce a picture of something using a pencil, pen etc

name: equal
trans: Equal means to have the same value, amount, or worth as something else.

sentences.english: Both candidates received an equal number of votes.
sentences.chinese: 两位候选人的得票数相等。

sentences.english: I’m not sure he’s equal to the task.
sentences.chinese: 我不确定他是否能胜任这项任务。

sentences.english: He treats all his staff as equals.
sentences.chinese: 他对所有员工都一视同仁。

sentences.english: Two plus two equals four.
sentences.chinese: 二加二等于四。

detailed_translations.english: the same in size, number, amount, value etc as something else
someone who is as important, intelligent etc as you are, or who has the same rights and opportunities as you do
to be exactly the same in size, number, or amount as something else

name: fix
trans: To fix means to repair or make something work properly again.

sentences.english: The interest rate has been fixed at 6.5%.
sentences.chinese: 利率已经定为6.5%。

sentences.english: The shelves should be fixed to the wall with screws.
sentences.chinese: 架子应当用螺丝固定在墙上。

detailed_translations.english: to decide on a limit for something, especially prices, costs etc, so that they do not change

name: hire
trans: To hire means to employ or bring someone on to do a job or task.

sentences.english: The best way to explore the island is to hire a car.
sentences.chinese: 在该岛寻幽访胜的最好方式就是租用一辆汽车。

sentences.english: What does it cost to hire a boat for a week?
sentences.chinese: 一艘小船租用一星期的费用是多少？

sentences.english: a car hire company
sentences.chinese: 汽车租赁公司

detailed_translations.english: to pay money to borrow something for a short period of time
an arrangement in which you pay a sum of money to borrow something for a short time

name: internal
trans: Internal refers to something that is located or exists inside of something else.

sentences.english: We have no interest in interfering in the internal affairs of other countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们对干涉其他国家内政不感兴趣。

sentences.english: the threat to internal security
sentences.chinese: 对国内安全的威胁

sentences.english: internal markets
sentences.chinese: 国内市场

sentences.english: There’s to be an internal inquiry into the whole affair.
sentences.chinese: 对整个事件将进行内部调查。

detailed_translations.english: within a particular country

name: join
trans: To join means to connect or link two or more things together.

sentences.english: Many sacrificed their weekend to join the hunt for the missing girl.
sentences.chinese: 许多人牺牲周末时间，加入了寻找失踪女孩的行动。

sentences.english: the benefits of joining our pension scheme
sentences.chinese: 参加我们的退休金计划的好处

sentences.english: Church leaders have joined the campaign to end foxhunting.
sentences.chinese: 教会领袖参与了禁止猎狐的运动。

sentences.english: Join the two pieces of wood with strong glue.
sentences.chinese: 用强力胶水把两块木头黏合起来。

detailed_translations.english: to begin to take part in an activity that other people are involved in

name: kill
trans: To kill means to cause the death of something or someone.

sentences.english: Why did she kill her husband?
sentences.chinese: 她为什么杀死丈夫？

sentences.english: Murray held a gun to his head and threatened to kill him.
sentences.chinese: 默里拿枪指着他的头并威胁要杀了他。

sentences.english: Four people were killed when a train plunged into a flooded river.
sentences.chinese: 火车冲进洪水泛滥的河中，造成四人身亡。

sentences.english: Bleach kills household germs.
sentences.chinese: 漂白剂能够杀灭日常病菌。

sentences.english: Smoking kills.
sentences.chinese: 吸烟会致人死亡。

sentences.english: The out-of-town shopping centre will kill local trade.
sentences.chinese: 城外的购物中心将令本地商业难以为继。

sentences.english: With time to kill, he took a cab to the centre.
sentences.chinese: 还有点时间可以消磨，于是他叫了一辆出租车去市中心。

detailed_translations.english: to make a person or animal die

name: sensitive
trans: Sensitive means easily affected or influenced by external factors.

sentences.english: a very sensitive child
sentences.chinese: 一个很敏感的小孩

sentences.english: a highly sensitive electronic camera
sentences.chinese: 高敏感度的电子摄像机

detailed_translations.english: easily upset or offended by events or things that people say

name: tap
trans: To tap means to hit lightly or gently, often to make a sound or get someone's attention.

sentences.english: She felt a tap on her shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得有人轻轻拍了拍她的肩膀。

sentences.english: I went up and tapped on the window.
sentences.chinese: 我走上去轻轻敲敲窗户。

detailed_translations.english: an act of hitting something lightly, especially to get someone’s attention
to hit your fingers lightly on something, for example to get someone’s attention

name: win
trans: To win means to achieve victory or success in a competition or contest.

sentences.english: Who’s winning (= who is most successful at this point in the game )?
sentences.chinese: 现在谁领先？

detailed_translations.english: to be the best or most successful in a competition, game, election etc
a success or victory, especially in sport

name: attack
trans: To attack is to try to hurt or harm someone or something.

sentences.english: a bomb attack
sentences.chinese: 炸弹袭击

sentences.english: a knife attack
sentences.chinese: 持刀攻击

sentences.english: an arson attack
sentences.chinese: 纵火袭击

sentences.english: victims of racial attacks
sentences.chinese: 种族袭击的受害者

detailed_translations.chinese: 攻击， 进攻； 突然发作
detailed_translations.english: an act of violence that is intended to hurt a person or damage a place

name: claim
trans: To claim is to say something is true or belongs to you.

sentences.english: I don’t claim to be a feminist, but I’d like to see more women in top jobs.
sentences.chinese: 我不会自称是女权主义者，但我希望看到更多的女性担任高职。

sentences.english: Opposition leaders will claim victory if the turnout is lower than 50%.
sentences.chinese: 如果投票率低于 50%，反对党领袖将宣布获胜。

detailed_translations.chinese: 声称，主张；对…提出要求，索取；使失踪或死亡；需要，值得
detailed_translations.english: to state that something is true, even though it has not been proved

detailed_translations.chinese: 要求； 认领； 索赔； 声称， 断言
detailed_translations.english: a statement that something is true, even though it has not been proved

name: constant
trans: Constant means something that doesn't change or stays the same.

sentences.english: There was a constant stream of visitors to the house.
sentences.chinese: 参观这幢房子的游客川流不息。

sentences.english: Amy lived in constant fear of being attacked.
sentences.chinese: 埃米一直生活在害怕遭到袭击的恐惧之中。

sentences.english: He kept in constant contact with his family while he was in Australia.
sentences.chinese: 他在澳大利亚时一直和家人保持着联系。

sentences.english: travelling at a constant speed
sentences.chinese: 以恒定速度行驶

detailed_translations.english: happening regularly or all the time

name: drag
trans: To drag is to pull something along the ground.

sentences.english: He grabbed her arm and dragged her into the room.
sentences.chinese: 他抓住她的手臂把她拖进房间。

sentences.english: He took a drag on his cigarette, and exhaled the smoke.
sentences.chinese: 他咂了口烟，然后吐出烟雾。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拖，拉；迫使，硬拉；拖着脚步走
detailed_translations.english: to pull something along the ground, often because it is too heavy to carry

detailed_translations.chinese: 累赘； 一吸， 一抽
detailed_translations.english: If you take a drag on a cigarette or pipe that you are smoking, you take in air through it

name: drink
trans: A drink is something you consume that is liquid.

sentences.english: You should drink plenty of water.
sentences.chinese: 你应该大量喝水。

sentences.english: What would you like to drink?
sentences.chinese: 你想喝点什么？

sentences.english: Take a seat while I get you something to drink .
sentences.chinese: 请坐，我去给你倒杯喝的。

sentences.english: She filled the glass and drank.
sentences.chinese: 她把杯子倒满后喝了起来。

detailed_translations.english: to take liquid into your mouth and swallow it
to take liquid into your mouth and swallow it
an amount of liquid that you drink, or the act of drinking something

name: guess
trans: To guess is to try to figure out an answer or solution without knowing for sure.

sentences.english: I’d say he’s around 50, but I’m only guessing.
sentences.chinese: 我想他50岁左右，不过也只是猜测。

sentences.english: What star sign are you? No, let me guess.
sentences.chinese: 你是什么星座的？别说，让我来猜猜看。

sentences.english: I’d say she’s about 35, but that’s only a guess.
sentences.chinese: 我说她大约35岁，不过那只是猜测。

detailed_translations.english: to try to answer a question or form an opinion when you are not sure whether you will be correct
an attempt to answer a question or make a judgement when you are not sure whether you will be correct

name: minor
trans: Minor means something that is not important or not serious.

sentences.english: We have made some minor changes to the program.
sentences.chinese: 我们对那个程序做了一些小改动。

sentences.english: a relatively minor error
sentences.chinese: 相对较小的错误

sentences.english: a minor road
sentences.chinese: 小路

sentences.english: They played only a minor role in local government.
sentences.chinese: 他们在当地政府里只是扮演次要角色。

detailed_translations.english: small and not very important or serious, especially when compared with other things

name: pull
trans: To pull is to use force to move something towards you.

sentences.english: Mom! Davey’s pulling my hair!
sentences.chinese: 妈妈! 戴维拽我的头发！

sentences.english: He gave her a sharp pull forward.
sentences.chinese: 他猛地把她往前一拉。

detailed_translations.english: to use your hands to make something or someone move towards you or in the direction that your hands are moving
an act of using force to move something towards you or in the same direction that you are moving

name: raw
trans: Raw means something that is not cooked or processed.

sentences.english: raw meat
sentences.chinese: 生肉

sentences.english: grated raw carrots
sentences.chinese: 磨碎的生胡萝卜

sentences.english: Cabbage can be eaten raw.
sentences.chinese: 洋白菜可以生吃。

sentences.english: raw sugar
sentences.chinese: 原糖

detailed_translations.english: not cooked

name: soft
trans: Soft means something that is not hard or firm and can be easily pressed.

sentences.english: a baby’s soft skin
sentences.chinese: 婴儿细嫩的皮肤

sentences.english: The fur was soft to the touch.
sentences.chinese: 这皮毛摸起来很柔滑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 软的，柔软的；温柔的，温和的；软弱的；笨的
detailed_translations.english: having a surface that is smooth and pleasant to touch

detailed_translations.chinese: 柔性；柔软的东西；柔软部分

name: solid
trans: Solid means something that is not liquid or gas and has a fixed shape.

sentences.english: The lake was frozen solid .
sentences.chinese: 湖水冻得结结实实。

sentences.english: It was good to be back on solid ground again.
sentences.chinese: 又能踏上坚实的土地感觉真好。

sentences.english: Is the baby eating solid food (= bread, meat etc ) yet?
sentences.chinese: 宝宝吃固体食物了吗？

sentences.english: The ship’s sonar can detect the presence of solid objects in the water.
sentences.chinese: 船上的声呐能够探测出水中的固体物。

sentences.english: the properties of liquids and solids
sentences.chinese: 液体和固体的特性

detailed_translations.english: hard or firm, with a fixed shape, and not a liquid or gas
a firm object or substance that has a fixed shape, not a gas or liquid

name: wear
trans: To wear is to have something on your body as clothing or accessory.

sentences.english: The cushions are starting to wear a little.
sentences.chinese: 这些靠垫开始有点磨破了。

sentences.english: His jeans have worn thin at the knees.
sentences.chinese: 他牛仔裤的膝盖处已经磨薄了。

sentences.english: You’ve worn a hole in your sock.
sentences.chinese: 你的袜子磨出了个洞。

detailed_translations.english: to become thinner or weaker after continuous use, or to make something do this

name: weird
trans: Weird means something that is strange or unusual.

sentences.english: A really weird thing happened last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚发生了一件非常奇怪的事。

sentences.english: He’s a weird bloke.
sentences.chinese: 他是个古怪的家伙。

sentences.english: They sell all sorts of weird and wonderful (= very strange ) products.
sentences.chinese: 他们出售各种稀奇古怪的产品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 古怪的， 离奇的； 怪诞的， 神秘而可怕的
detailed_translations.english: very strange and unusual, and difficult to understand or explain

name: wonder
trans: To wonder is to think about something or be curious about it.

sentences.english: What are they going to do now, I wonder ?
sentences.chinese: 我想知道，他们现在打算怎么办呢？

sentences.english: He’s been leaving work early a lot – it makes you wonder , doesn’t it?
sentences.chinese: 他最近经常提早下班——让人觉得奇怪，是不是？

detailed_translations.english: to think about something that you are not sure about and try to guess what is true, what will happen etc

name: annual
trans: Annual means something that happens once a year.

sentences.english: The school trip has become an annual event.
sentences.chinese: 学校组织的旅行成了一年一度的活动。
